center"]},"filesize":6192701},"source_url":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/GettyImages-155382394.jpg","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/media\/2124879"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/media"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/types\/attachment"}],"replies":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/comments?post=2124879"}],"author":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/tc\/v1\/users\/133574210"}]}}],"wp:term":[[{"id":21587494,"link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/security\/","name":"Security","slug":"security","taxonomy":"category","parent":0,"rapidData":{"pt":"","pct":""},"submenu_categories":[],"_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/categories\/21587494"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/categories"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/category"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?categories=21587494"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?categories=21587494"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?categories=21587494"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}},{"id":20429,"link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/startups\/","name":"Startups","slug":"startups","taxonomy":"category","parent":0,"rapidData":{"pt":"","pct":""},"submenu_categories":[],"_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/categories\/20429"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/categories"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/category"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?categories=20429"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?categories=20429"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?categories=20429"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}}],[{"id":965824,"link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/tag\/cybersecurity\/","name":"cybersecurity","slug":"cybersecurity","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/965824"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=965824"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=965824"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=965824"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=965824"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}},{"id":576849089,"link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/tag\/ec-cybersecurity\/","name":"EC Cybersecurity","slug":"ec-cybersecurity","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/576849089"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=576849089"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=576849089"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=576849089"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=576849089"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}},{"id":576846278,"link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/tag\/ec-how-to\/","name":"EC How To","slug":"ec-how-to","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/576846278"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=576846278"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=576846278"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=576846278"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=576846278"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}},{"id":42210,"link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/tag\/liability\/","name":"liability","slug":"liability","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/42210"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=42210"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=42210"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=42210"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=42210"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}},{"id":1705456,"link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/tag\/solarwinds\/","name":"SolarWinds","slug":"solarwinds","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/1705456"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=1705456"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=1705456"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=1705456"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=1705456"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}}],[],[],[{"id":576796357,"link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/extracrunch\/work\/","name":"Work","slug":"work","taxonomy":"tc_ec_category","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_ec_category\/576796357"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_ec_category"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/tc_ec_category"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tc_ec_category=576796357"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}}],[]]}},{"id":2124283,"date":"2021-03-12T23:28:15","date_gmt":"2021-03-13T07:28:15","guid":{"rendered":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/?p=2124283"},"modified":"2021-03-15T05:15:32","modified_gmt":"2021-03-15T12:15:32","slug":"8-czech-vcs-on-green-shoots-pandemic-impacts-and-2021-opportunities","status":"publish","type":"post","link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/12\/8-czech-vcs-on-green-shoots-pandemic-impacts-and-2021-opportunities\/","title":{"rendered":"8 Czech VCs on green shoots, pandemic impacts and 2021 opportunities"},"content":{"rendered":"<p id=\"speakable-summary\">While London, Paris, Berlin and Stockholm feature regularly in tech coverage, the rest of Europe has been busy.<\/p>\n<p>The Czech Republic may be better known for beer, hockey, and the sights of Prague, but its entrepreneurial community is as ambitious as any.<\/p>\n<p>For instance, there is Integromat, which did not raise any external capital but sold for around 2.5 billion crowns ($114 million), making its seven Czech founders into multimillionaires. Prague&#8217;s Memsource is valued at approximately 1.3 billion crowns or $59 million. But this is just the tip of the iceberg.<\/p><div class=\"piano-inline-promo\"><\/div>\n<p>To unpack this rare gem of Europe\u2019s startup scene, we spoke to eight area investors.<\/p>\n<p>Among the trends they identified are startups in B2B, business automation processes, e-commerce, AI, SaaS and COVID-19-related solutions, as well as &#8220;smart&#8221; everything: factories, cities, offices, etc. Other themes included cybersecurity, AR\/VR, remote work, and cybersecurity.<\/p>\n<p>Saturated areas included cryptocurrency, blockchain, fintech and martech. The people we spoke to said they see travel, dating apps and other businesses traditionally based on physical interaction as weaker segments. Still, new opportunities are popping up in remote work, psychedelics and wellness.<\/p>\n<hr \/>\n<p style=\"text-align: center;\">Use discount code <strong>CZECHIA<\/strong> to <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/subscribe\/\">save 25% off a 1-year Extra Crunch membership.<\/a><br \/>\nThis offer is only available to readers in Europe and expires on April 30, 2021.<\/p>\n<hr \/>\n<p>Respondents said they invest around 50% inside Czechia and 50% across Central and Eastern Europe, while some are more focused across CEE generally, with some percentage of the fund supporting startups that have scaled to the U.S.<\/p>\n<p>Most said their investments hadn&#8217;t been significantly impacted by COVID-19, but future uncertainly is a concern. The advice is to \u201cbe frugal to accommodate to the new situation and roll on.\u201d<\/p>\n<p>As far as green shoots, COVID-19 has \u201cplayed a role of an accelerator for innovation in many business areas and even e-government and other rigid\/conservative industries,\u201d said one. D2C startups have benefitted and \u201cZoom selling&#8221; now seems \u201ctotally plausible.\u201d<\/p>\n<p>We surveyed:<\/p>\n<ul>\n<li><a href=\"https:\/\/www.linkedin.com\/in\/petra-westerlaan-kon%C4%8Del%C3%ADkov%C3%A1-546650b8\/\">Petra Kon\u010del\u00edkov\u00e1<\/a>, partner, <a href=\"http:\/\/www.nation1.vc\">Nation1.vc<\/a><\/li>\n<li><a href=\"https:\/\/www.crunchbase.com\/person\/oleksander-bondarev\">Oleksander Bondarev<\/a>, associate, <a href=\"https:\/\/www.credoventures.com\/\">Credo Ventures<\/a><\/li>\n<li><a href=\"https:\/\/www.crunchbase.com\/person\/ondrej-bartos\">Ondrej Bartos<\/a>, founding partner, <a href=\"http:\/\/www.credoventures.com\">Credo Ventures<\/a><\/li>\n<li><a href=\"https:\/\/www.linkedin.com\/in\/osmansalih\/\">Osman Salih<\/a>, associate, <a href=\"http:\/\/www.bebolt.cz\">Bolt Start Up Development a.s.<\/a><\/li>\n<li><a href=\"https:\/\/www.linkedin.com\/in\/lukaskonecny1\">Luk\u00e1\u0161 Kone\u010dn\u00fd<\/a>, principal, <a href=\"http:\/\/ysoftventures.com\">Y Soft Ventures<\/a><\/li>\n<li><a href=\"https:\/\/www.linkedin.com\/in\/vaclavpavlecka\/\">Vaclav Pavlecka<\/a>, managing partner, <a href=\"http:\/\/www.airventures.eu\">Air Ventures<\/a><\/li>\n<li><a href=\"https:\/\/www.linkedin.com\/in\/roman-horacek\/\">Roman Horacek<\/a>, partner, <a href=\"http:\/\/www.reflexcapital.com\">Reflex Capital<\/a><\/li>\n<\/ul>\n<hr \/>\n<h2>Petra Kon\u010del\u00edkov\u00e1, partner, Nation1.vc<\/h2>\n<p><strong>What trends are you most excited about investing in, generally?<\/strong><br \/>\nInnovative.<\/p>\n<p><strong>What\u2019s your latest, most exciting investment?<\/strong><br \/>\n<a href=\"http:\/\/www.getSnuggs.com\">Snuggs<\/a>.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Are there startups that you wish you would see in the industry but don\u2019t? What are some overlooked opportunities right now?<\/strong><br \/>\nI miss a more innovative approach.<\/p>\n<p><strong>What are you looking for in your next investment, in general?<\/strong><br \/>\nSteady rapid growth, innovative mind.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Which areas are either oversaturated or would be too hard to compete in at this point for a new startup? What other types of products\/services are you wary or concerned about?<\/strong><br \/>\nSocial media, logistics, travel.<\/p>\n<p><strong>How much are you focused on investing in your local ecosystem versus other startup hubs (or everywhere) in general? More than 50%? Less?<\/strong><br \/>\nWe are solely focusing on the European market, with an impact on the Czech Republic.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Which industries in your city and region seem well positioned to thrive, or not, long term? What are companies you are excited about (your portfolio or not), which founders?<\/strong><br \/>\nHealthcare, industry 4.0.<\/p>\n<p><strong>How should investors in other cities think about the overall investment climate and opportunities in your city?<\/strong><br \/>\nHuge potential.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Do you expect to see a surge in more founders coming from geographies outside major cities in the years to come, with startup hubs losing people due to the pandemic and lingering concerns, plus the attraction of remote work?<\/strong><br \/>\nRemote work is not an issue, but the pandemic has of course huge impact on startups. They are forced to pivot and accommodate to this new world.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Which industry segments that you invest in look weaker or more exposed to potential shifts in consumer and business behavior because of COVID-19? What are the opportunities startups may be able to tap into during these unprecedented times?<\/strong><br \/>\nTravel and gastro.<\/p>\n<p><strong>How has COVID-19 impacted your investment strategy? What are the biggest worries of the founders in your portfolio? What is your advice to startups in your portfolio right now?<\/strong><br \/>\nAccommodate to the new situation and roll on.<\/p>\n<p><strong>What is a moment that has given you hope in the last month or so? This can be professional, personal or a mix of the two.<\/strong><br \/>\nVaccination.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Who are key startup people you see creating success locally, whether investors, founders or even other types of startup ecosystems roles like lawyers, designers, growth experts, etc. We\u2019re trying to highlight the movers and shakers who outsiders might not know.<\/strong><br \/>\nFinancial experts \u2014 financial planning, CFOs to hire as an service from agencies.<\/p>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"Qwaglh5xK1\"><p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/02\/26\/copenhagen-investors-are-interested-in-climate-but-also-heading-to-the-baltics\/\">6 Copenhagen investors share their outlook on investing in 2021<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p><iframe class=\"wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" title=\"&#8220;6 Copenhagen investors share their outlook on investing in 2021&#8221; &#8212; TechCrunch\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/02\/26\/copenhagen-investors-are-interested-in-climate-but-also-heading-to-the-baltics\/embed\/#?secret=Qwaglh5xK1\" data-secret=\"Qwaglh5xK1\" width=\"800\" height=\"450\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n<h2>Oleksander Bondarev, associate, Credo Ventures<\/h2>\n<p><strong>What trends are you most excited about investing in, generally?<\/strong><br \/>\nDeveloper tools, communication apps, applied AI.<\/p>\n<p><strong>What\u2019s your latest, most exciting investment?<\/strong><br \/>\nAround.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Are there startups that you wish you would see in the industry but don\u2019t? What are some overlooked opportunities right now?<\/strong><br \/>\nCloud CI\/CD.<\/p>\n<p><strong>What are you looking for in your next investment, in general?<\/strong><br \/>\nGreat team.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Which areas are either oversaturated or would be too hard to compete in at this point for a new startup? What other types of products\/services are you wary or concerned about?<\/strong><br \/>\nMartech.<\/p>\n<p><strong>How much are you focused on investing in your local ecosystem versus other startup hubs (or everywhere) in general? More than 50%? Less?<\/strong><br \/>\nOnly in founders from: Czech Republic, Poland, Slovakia, Slovenia, Croatia, Romania or Hungary.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Which industries in your city and region seem well positioned to thrive, or not, long term? What are companies you are excited about (your portfolio or not), which founders?<\/strong><br \/>\nProductboard, UiPath, Pricefx, Supernova, Spaceflow.<\/p>\n<p><strong>How should investors in other cities think about the overall investment climate and opportunities in your city?<\/strong><br \/>\nMaturing.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Do you expect to see a surge in more founders coming from geographies outside major cities in the years to come, with startup hubs losing people due to the pandemic and lingering concerns, plus the attraction of remote work?<\/strong><br \/>\nYes.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Which industry segments that you invest in look weaker or more exposed to potential shifts in consumer and business behavior because of COVID-19? What are the opportunities startups may be able to tap into during these unprecedented times?<\/strong><br \/>\nEnabling communication, transparency within the remote workforce.<\/p>\n<p><strong>How has COVID-19 impacted your investment strategy? What are the biggest worries of the founders in your portfolio? What is your advice to startups in your portfolio right now?<\/strong><br \/>\nBe frugal.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Any other thoughts you want to share with TechCrunch readers?<\/strong><br \/>\nWe are trying to be the most founder-friendly fund in the region. As an ex-founder (Olek) I love speaking with and advising all startups that come my way :)<\/p>\n<h2>Ondrej Bartos, founding partner, Credo Ventures<\/h2>\n<p><strong>What trends are you most excited about investing in, generally?<\/strong><br \/>\nAutomation, AI, enabling remote, authentication.<\/p>\n<p><strong>What\u2019s your latest, most exciting investment?<\/strong><br \/>\nTypingDNA.<\/p>\n<p><strong>What are you looking for in your next investment, in general?<\/strong><br \/>\nOutstanding founders tackling big opportunity.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Which areas are either oversaturated or would be too hard to compete in at this point for a new startup? What other types of products\/services are you wary or concerned about?<\/strong><br \/>\nVR\/AR has been an area with lots of investment, therefore very competitive. AI is overhyped but most AI are actually not that intelligent.<\/p>\n<p><strong>How much are you focused on investing in your local ecosystem versus other startup hubs (or everywhere) in general? More than 50%? Less?<\/strong><br \/>\nLess. We focus on Central Europe as a region (if that would count as local, then more than 50%).<\/p>\n<p><strong>Which industries in your city and region seem well positioned to thrive, or not, long term? What are companies you are excited about (your portfolio or not), which founders?<\/strong><br \/>\nCentral Europe is well positioned in automation, security, developer tools and analytics. I&#8217;m most excited about UiPath, Productboard, Pricefx, TypingDNA, Spaceflow, Around (in our portfolio). Best CE founders are in my view Daniel Dines, Hubert Palan, Marcin Cichon plus Oliver Dlouh\u00fd (Kiwi.com).<\/p>\n<p><strong>How should investors in other cities think about the overall investment climate and opportunities in your city?<\/strong><br \/>\nThere are a lot of great developers in Prague, good energy and enough success stories and role models to follow. There is a lot of investment capital there (just as everywhere else I guess), not too much smart money yet, so definitely opportunity for good VCs to take a look (and they are looking).<\/p>\n<p><strong>Do you expect to see a surge in more founders coming from geographies outside major cities in the years to come, with startup hubs losing people due to the pandemic and lingering concerns, plus the attraction of remote work?<\/strong><br \/>\nI have no doubts that the pandemic has been accelerating remote work, which ultimately should lead to more remote-first startups which might benefit new geos.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Which industry segments that you invest in look weaker or more exposed to potential shifts in consumer and business behavior because of COVID-19? What are the opportunities startups may be able to tap into during these unprecedented times?<\/strong><br \/>\nTravel and hospitality seem most fragile and unpredictable due to COVID-19. Remote and enabling remote seem like the biggest opportunity; automation and enabling digital transformation are attractive as well.<\/p>\n<p><strong>How has COVID-19 impacted your investment strategy? What are the biggest worries of the founders in your portfolio? What is your advice to startups in your portfolio right now?<\/strong><br \/>\nOur investment strategy is unchanged; actually we&#8217;ll double down on it. There is a lot of opportunity for good tech startups, technology is what&#8217;s helping people and countries to get out of crises faster with less damage. Our advice to startups is still the same: Focus on your cause and try to solve problems in your space better than anybody else.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Are you seeing \u201cgreen shoots\u201d regarding revenue growth, retention or other momentum in your portfolio as they adapt to the pandemic?<\/strong><br \/>\nWe definitely see green shoots in some of the enterprise software companies. &#8220;Zoom selling&#8221; now seems totally plausible, sales cycles shortened in some verticals as companies need to digitize and enable remote work.<\/p>\n<p><strong>What is a moment that has given you hope in the last month or so? This can be professional, personal or a mix of the two.<\/strong><br \/>\nI&#8217;ve always had hope. Yes, there have been low moments especially when quarantined, but overall I haven&#8217;t lost hope for people to cope with this unprecedented situation, and for technology to play a significant role in the recovery. I still have this hope :)<\/p>\n<p><strong>Any other thoughts you want to share with TechCrunch readers?<\/strong><br \/>\nI feel like I had been traveling too much, two- or three-day transatlantic trips make little sense and I think I won&#8217;t go back there. Also, I don&#8217;t think I&#8217;ll go back to 5+ days in the office every week, home office works fine with me and it will stay with me and the company in some capacity. That being said, it is what I feel now. I may be wrong and things may go back to &#8220;old normal&#8221; \u2014 which I would consider a big mistake and lost opportunity.<\/p>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"X7up9WeClm\"><p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/02\/18\/8-investors-discuss-stockholms-maturing-startup-ecosystem\/\">8 investors discuss Stockholm&#8217;s maturing startup ecosystem<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p><iframe class=\"wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" title=\"&#8220;8 investors discuss Stockholm&#8217;s maturing startup ecosystem&#8221; &#8212; TechCrunch\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/02\/18\/8-investors-discuss-stockholms-maturing-startup-ecosystem\/embed\/#?secret=X7up9WeClm\" data-secret=\"X7up9WeClm\" width=\"800\" height=\"450\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n<h2>Osman Salih, associate, Bolt Start Up Development a.s.<\/h2>\n<p><strong>What trends are you most excited about investing in, generally?<\/strong><br \/>\nWe are looking for synergies with our parent company O2 Czech republic and other companies under the PPF Group.<\/p>\n<p><strong>What\u2019s your latest, most exciting investment?<\/strong><br \/>\nIP Fabric.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Are there startups that you wish you would see in the industry but don\u2019t? What are some overlooked opportunities right now?<\/strong><br \/>\nWe would like to see more insurtech startups in Europe.<\/p>\n<p><strong>What are you looking for in your next investment, in general?<\/strong><br \/>\nWe are looking for synergies with our partner companies rather looking into a specific branch.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Which areas are either oversaturated or would be too hard to compete in at this point for a new startup? What other types of products\/services are you wary or concerned about?<\/strong><br \/>\nFintech is oversaturated with very low margins.<\/p>\n<p><strong>How much are you focused on investing in your local ecosystem versus other startup hubs (or everywhere) in general? More than 50%? Less?<\/strong><br \/>\nWe mostly invest locally, but our most successful investment was in Taxify (now Bolt).<\/p>\n<p><strong>Which industries in your city and region seem well positioned to thrive, or not, long term? What are companies you are excited about (your portfolio or not), which founders?<\/strong><br \/>\nDefinitely security domain is best positioned. We are excited about IP Fabric (founder is ex-Cisco CEO Pavel Bykov), Whalebone (R. Malovi\u010d), Wultra (P. Dvo\u0159\u00e1k).<\/p>\n<p><strong>How should investors in other cities think about the overall investment climate and opportunities in your city?<\/strong><br \/>\nThe interest is bigger, a lot of successful startups raise demand for opportunities.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Do you expect to see a surge in more founders coming from geographies outside major cities in the years to come, with startup hubs losing people due to the pandemic and lingering concerns, plus the attraction of remote work?<\/strong><br \/>\nWe don&#8217;t think so, local network is important. Remote work is not for everyone.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Which industry segments that you invest in look weaker or more exposed to potential shifts in consumer and business behavior because of COVID-19? What are the opportunities startups may be able to tap into during these unprecedented times?<\/strong><br \/>\nThere will be shifts in retail. This is an opportunity for startups like Pygmalios, which provide analytics for retail.<\/p>\n<p><strong>How has COVID-19 impacted your investment strategy? What are the biggest worries of the founders in your portfolio? What is your advice to startups in your portfolio right now?<\/strong><br \/>\nLuckily the impact is not big. Biggest worries are about difficulties with travel abroad for business meetings. Our advice is hold the runway longer :-)<\/p>\n<p><strong>Are you seeing \u201cgreen shoots\u201d regarding revenue growth, retention or other momentum in your portfolio as they adapt to the pandemic?<\/strong><br \/>\nYes, demand for call center tools like omnichannel solution mluvii.com, which works at the home office move up significantly.<\/p>\n<p><strong>What is a moment that has given you hope in the last month or so? This can be professional, personal or a mix of the two.<\/strong><br \/>\nAt spring our country was &#8220;best in COVID&#8221; and now it is &#8220;worst in COVID.&#8221; Last spring thousands of people from the startup community helped and came up with brilliant ideas, apps and solutions but at the end most outcomes (like <a href=\"https:\/\/erouska.cz\/en\">eRou\u0161ka<\/a> and <a href=\"https:\/\/koronavirus.mzcr.cz\/en\/\">https:\/\/koronavirus.mzcr.cz\/en\/<\/a>) were screwed by slow or faulty decisions of government. Instead of hope I&#8217;m disappointed, but I believe that vaccination will help us to get life back on the track.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Who are key startup people you see creating success locally, whether investors, founders or even other types of startup ecosystems roles like lawyers, designers, growth experts, etc. We\u2019re trying to highlight the movers and shakers who outsiders might not know.<\/strong><br \/>\nPatrik Jur\u00e1nek from Startup Disrupt community.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Any other thoughts you want to share with TechCrunch readers?<\/strong><br \/>\nPrague is great and safe city for living \u2014 when you setup a branch in Prague you can attract people from all of the CEE region to move in.<\/p>\n<h2>Luk\u00e1\u0161 Kone\u010dn\u00fd, principal, Y Soft Ventures<\/h2>\n<p><strong>What trends are you most excited about investing in, generally?<\/strong><br \/>\nAnything that helps businesses run smarter is something we would like to take a look at. More specifically we are interested in areas such as Internet of Things, smart factories, smart cities, smart office, cybersecurity, big data and AR\/VR. And especially when there is some kind of hardware involved \u2014 that something we really love.<\/p>\n<p><strong>What\u2019s your latest, most exciting investment?<\/strong><br \/>\n<a href=\"https:\/\/vrgineers.com\">VRgineers<\/a>.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Are there startups that you wish you would see in the industry but don\u2019t? What are some overlooked opportunities right now?<\/strong><br \/>\nIt would be great to see more startups focusing on hardware. Admittedly, creating hardware and scaling-up a hardware-focused business is always a bigger challenge, but the opportunities are so vast and many are yet untapped.<\/p>\n<p><strong>What are you looking for in your next investment, in general?<\/strong><br \/>\nApart from the &#8220;obvious&#8221; aspects such as innovativeness, global potential, scalability, strong team and fit with our investment thesis, we look for founders who show great strategic thinking and execution skills, who really understand the market and their customers&#8217; needs and listen to feedback.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Which areas are either oversaturated or would be too hard to compete in at this point for a new startup? What other types of products\/services are you wary or concerned about?<\/strong><br \/>\nConsidering our focus on B2B, we have better overview of this part of the economy. Lately, we have seen a huge number of startups using AI\/ML for computer vision or natural language processing use cases creating very similar products, meaning it will be rather difficult for them to differentiate and outperform the rest of the competition. But that does not mean that a new revolutionary idea cannot appear.<\/p>\n<p><strong>How much are you focused on investing in your local ecosystem versus other startup hubs (or everywhere) in general? More than 50%? Less?<\/strong><br \/>\nOur focus is on the Central European region \u2014 so far we have invested in the Czech Republic and Slovakia, but we are open to founders from other neighboring countries as well. The majority of our portfolio is located in the Brno\/South Moravia region, where Y Soft is based. It is not an outcome of an intentional strategy, but just the reality of which startups interested us the most.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Which industries in your city and region seem well positioned to thrive, or not, long term? What are companies you are excited about (your portfolio or not), which founders?<\/strong><br \/>\nGenerally, the Czech startup ecosystem is getting more mature, especially thanks to serial entrepreneurs as well as more experienced first-time founders, and the developing business angel\/VC ecosystem. It is hard to pick just one industry, as the spectrum of companies is very vast.<\/p>\n<p><strong>How should investors in other cities think about the overall investment climate and opportunities in your city?<\/strong><br \/>\nFrom the investors&#8217; point of view, the Czech startup ecosystem can provide a lot of interesting opportunities, and especially for foreign investors the investments can be a &#8220;good value for money,&#8221; even though the VC ecosystem has become more competitive in the last years due to influx of new money. The seed and partly Series A segment can be seen as rather saturated, but there is a significant potential in the larger Series A or later-stage investments.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Do you expect to see a surge in more founders coming from geographies outside major cities in the years to come, with startup hubs losing people due to the pandemic and lingering concerns, plus the attraction of remote work?<\/strong><br \/>\nThe main Czech hubs, Prague and Brno, are probably not going to see their status weakened, as they are not only business centers, but also have the main universities where the talented people are and are hearts of the cultural life that is attractive to many. But we will see a shift toward remote woking, allowing founders to tap a wider talent pool.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Which industry segments that you invest in look weaker or more exposed to potential shifts in consumer and business behavior because of COVID-19? What are the opportunities startups may be able to tap into during these unprecedented times?<\/strong><br \/>\nWe believe that after the shock caused by COVID-19 fades away, there will be more opportunities for the companies in segments we invest in, as the induced trends are only forcing businesses to run smarter. The trends most relevant to us will be those associated with accelerated digital transformation, changes in supply chains and evolution of workspaces.<\/p>\n<p><strong>How has COVID-19 impacted your investment strategy? What are the biggest worries of the founders in your portfolio? What is your advice to startups in your portfolio right now?<\/strong><br \/>\nCOVID-19 has not impacted our strategy. The only changes were on the tactical level, as for a certain period of time we shifted more capacities to portfolio support. Most of our founders had to deal with a negative impact on their sales funnel, as some customers postponed or cancelled the planned deals. Some of the founders had to deal with disruptions in the distribution channels, as some of their partners&#8217; businesses were hit rather hard, and a small number of companies had to resolve issues with their supply chain. These challenges are still, to an extent, worries to our portfolio companies, as the economic development is still uncertain. To deal with the situation, cash flow became the main focus, together with more active communication with key business partners throughout the value chains.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Are you seeing \u201cgreen shoots\u201d regarding revenue growth, retention or other momentum in your portfolio as they adapt to the pandemic?<\/strong><br \/>\nWe have seen a lot of positive signals in retention and some green shoots regarding revenue, but the situation is still too fragile.<\/p>\n<p><strong>What is a moment that has given you hope in the last month or so? This can be professional, personal or a mix of the two.<\/strong><br \/>\nIt is hard to find glimmers of hope lately, as the situation in the Czech Republic is really not developing well. However, I was recently able to participate in several online events that young entrepreneurs, in some cases even high school or university students, attended to present their projects or to improve their business skills. And it was great to see people who are still deeply interested in \u2014 and invested in \u2014 the entrepreneurial path, regardless of the current situation.<\/p>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"wi568msye5\"><p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/02\/13\/investors-say-belgiums-startups-are-poised-for-international-expansion\/\">Investors say Belgium&#8217;s startups are poised for international expansion<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p><iframe class=\"wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" title=\"&#8220;Investors say Belgium&#8217;s startups are poised for international expansion&#8221; &#8212; TechCrunch\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/02\/13\/investors-say-belgiums-startups-are-poised-for-international-expansion\/embed\/#?secret=wi568msye5\" data-secret=\"wi568msye5\" width=\"800\" height=\"450\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n<h2>Vaclav Pavlecka, managing partner, Air Ventures<\/h2>\n<p><strong>What trends are you most excited about investing in, generally?<\/strong><br \/>\nWe are sector agnostic, so it&#8217;s not so much about &#8220;trends,&#8221; rather than other aspects of startups in our pipeline.<\/p>\n<p><strong>What\u2019s your latest, most exciting investment?<\/strong><br \/>\nCross Network Intelligence.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Are there startups that you wish you would see in the industry but don\u2019t? What are some overlooked opportunities right now?<\/strong><br \/>\nMany sectors are &#8220;to-be-disrupted yet&#8221; but for example I believe that the predictive medicine (that helps you avoid the problem instead the one that is helping to solve the problem that is already there) will be one of the major trends for the near future.<\/p>\n<p><strong>What are you looking for in your next investment, in general?<\/strong><br \/>\nDistinctive unique selling proposition, market-oriented and sales-hungry team, disruptive potential, upmarket potential.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Which areas are either oversaturated or would be too hard to compete in at this point for a new startup? What other types of products\/services are you wary or concerned about?<\/strong><br \/>\nSocial networks in general are the type of services I am concerned about due to a long-term impact on one&#8217;s mental health and due to social confirmation bias and decreasing ability for a healthy unheated critical discussion in society. As for oversaturation, it is hard to generalize, since every industry still has its niches. But a top of my mind idea for an oversaturated market is the marketing technologies sector (as well as many other software products). Solutions are easily replicable (think chatbots) and successful only at the limited market.<\/p>\n<p><strong>How much are you focused on investing in your local ecosystem versus other startup hubs (or everywhere) in general? More than 50%? Less?<\/strong><br \/>\nWe tend to focus on companies with the local strings (with exceptions made \u2014 e.g., Californian clothing startup Nahmias).<\/p>\n<p><strong>Which industries in your city and region seem well positioned to thrive, or not, long term? What are companies you are excited about (your portfolio or not), which founders?<\/strong><br \/>\nWe see a huge potential of local talents in cybersecurity, industry automation (due to the fact that Czechia has one of the densest &#8220;per capita&#8221; car production in the world), gaming industry (including esports), crypto and health. As for companies I think Apiary, Beat Games, Warhorse gaming studio, Mews.com, Kiwi.com, Snuggs, Prusa Research, Productboard, Rossum, Integromat and Alheon.<\/p>\n<p><strong>How should investors in other cities think about the overall investment climate and opportunities in your city?<\/strong><br \/>\n&#8220;Local&#8221; VCs and investors are definitely willing to make meaningful connections and co-invest. The ecosystem is more mature every year and grows stronger. Prague and the surrounding region also has its charm that attracts many talents as the city has an ideal balance between the life quality and costs in comparison to other metropolitan areas.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Do you expect to see a surge in more founders coming from geographies outside major cities in the years to come, with startup hubs losing people due to the pandemic and lingering concerns, plus the attraction of remote work?<\/strong><br \/>\nI believe that we will see a big &#8220;return to the good part of the old system&#8221; in the end of this year\/early 2022, so I won&#8217;t expect the big shift in the sense of geographic &#8220;founder density&#8221; outside of the major cities. If, however, the COVID-19 restrictions should last more years, then many social changes can be sparked, including geographic mobility and flexibility.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Which industry segments that you invest in look weaker or more exposed to potential shifts in consumer and business behavior because of COVID-19? What are the opportunities startups may be able to tap into during these unprecedented times?<\/strong><br \/>\nNo surprise there \u2014 the whole travel industry, gastronomical industry and culture tech are in the deepest crisis in decades. Many other industries are under big pressure to increase the speed of change, e.g., the education industry, the entertainment industry. Also in general small to medium businesses are having tough times locally, since the government restrictions are not being implemented efficiently and their communication isn&#8217;t built around a sound strategy.<\/p>\n<p><strong>How has COVID-19 impacted your investment strategy? What are the biggest worries of the founders in your portfolio? What is your advice to startups in your portfolio right now?<\/strong><br \/>\nOur investment strategy is built around long-lasting principles and therefore we didn&#8217;t have to change it completely. Of course the investment appetite in sectors hit by crisis decreased significantly but other opportunities emerged. As for portfolio impact, proptech vertical was hit heavily and some of our companies had to reiterate their product offering. Our general advice to any startup in our portfolio is to boost the dialogue with their customers, learn how their needs are shifting (if so) and try to steer the wheel in the right time. If needed, we are ready to support our founders financially and also teamwise, since we are hands-on investors.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Are you seeing \u201cgreen shoots\u201d regarding revenue growth, retention or other momentum in your portfolio as they adapt to the pandemic?<\/strong><br \/>\nD2C startups with a sound unit economy and their own strong distribution channels are thriving (not only locally). This includes our portfolio.<\/p>\n<p><strong>What is a moment that has given you hope in the last month or so? This can be professional, personal or a mix of the two.<\/strong><br \/>\nNot losing hope really. I think people were in much deeper crises and that we refer to the current situation as we do only due to lack of historical comparability. We are still living in times of prosperity and the pandemic will eventually go away thanks to the scientific progress people have achieved. So I think the beacon of positive change are all the RNA vaccines out there. I am thrilled by the restless work of scientists involved in their development and I believe they should receive much greater social credit than they do nowadays.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Who are key startup people you see creating success locally, whether investors, founders or even other types of startup ecosystems roles like lawyers, designers, growth experts, etc. We\u2019re trying to highlight the movers and shakers who outsiders might not know.<\/strong><br \/>\nCedric Maloux, Lubo Smid, Dita Form\u00e1nkov\u00e1, Tomas Cironis, Ondrej Bartos.<\/p>\n<h2>Roman Horacek , partner, Reflex Capital<\/h2>\n<p><strong>What trends are you most excited about investing in, generally?<\/strong><br \/>\nB2B, business automation processes, e-commerce, AI, SaaS, COVID-19-related solutions \u2014 across verticals (remote work, conferencing, etc.).<\/p>\n<p><strong>What\u2019s your latest, most exciting investment?<\/strong><br \/>\nWebnode, SignageOS and some others that unfortunately cannot be disclosed yet :)<\/p>\n<p><strong>Are there startups that you wish you would see in the industry but don\u2019t? What are some overlooked opportunities right now?<\/strong><br \/>\nI would like to see more AI startups (actually using AI).<\/p>\n<p><strong>What are you looking for in your next investment, in general?<\/strong><br \/>\nRockstar founders, existing and real market need, scalable solution with solid IP.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Which areas are either oversaturated or would be too hard to compete in at this point for a new startup? What other types of products\/services are you wary or concerned about?<\/strong><br \/>\nCryptocurrencies, blockchain, talent marketplaces.<\/p>\n<p><strong>How much are you focused on investing in your local ecosystem versus other startup hubs (or everywhere) in general? More than 50%? Less?<\/strong><br \/>\nAs of now our portfolio is approximately 75%\/25% (75% CEE and 25% USA\/other).<\/p>\n<p><strong>Which industries in your city and region seem well positioned to thrive, or not, long term? What are companies you are excited about (your portfolio or not), which founders?<\/strong><br \/>\nOur companies \u2014 APIFY, Productboard, Smartlook, Alice Technologies, SingageOS. Other companies \u2014 DoDo, Around, UiPath, Pex,<\/p>\n<p><strong>How should investors in other cities think about the overall investment climate and opportunities in your city?<\/strong><br \/>\nGreat technical talent with superb ideas falling behind with go-to-market and sales skills.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Do you expect to see a surge in more founders coming from geographies outside major cities in the years to come, with startup hubs losing people due to the pandemic and lingering concerns, plus the attraction of remote work?<\/strong><br \/>\nI don&#8217;t think so, I believe the talent will still be attracted by existing major hubs. Smaller the team, more interaction is needed. Despite all the innovations in remote work one-to-one interactions and social time cannot be fully replaced (yet).<\/p>\n<p><strong>Which industry segments that you invest in look weaker or more exposed to potential shifts in consumer and business behavior because of COVID-19? What are the opportunities startups may be able to tap into during these unprecedented times?<\/strong><br \/>\nExposed \u2014 travel, dating apps \u2026 all businesses traditionally based on physical interaction. Not a surprise I guess :) Opportunities \u2014 remote work applications, psychedelic applications, well-being startups, life science solutions, logistics and related industries, e-commerce for SMEs.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Has COVID-19 impacted your investment strategy? What are the biggest worries of the founders in your portfolio? What is your advice to startups in your portfolio right now?<\/strong><br \/>\nNot really. Our No. 1 investment criteria is strong founders. Most of them were able to adjust their business models to the new market conditions. Spring 2020 advice was cash is king, stay frugal and adjust your business to the new market conditions ASAP or others will.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Are you seeing \u201cgreen shoots\u201d regarding revenue growth, retention or other momentum in your portfolio as they adapt to the pandemic?<\/strong><br \/>\nYes. I believe COVID-19 played a role of an accelerator for innovations in many business areas and even e-government and other rigid\/conservative industries.<\/p>\n<p><strong>What is a moment that has given you hope in the last month or so? This can be professional, personal or a mix of the two.<\/strong><br \/>\nGiven all the events of 2020 we had a solid year as a fund. What was inspiring \u2014 seeing founders coming across whatever obstacles thrown under their legs \u2026 overcoming them with new ideas\/inventions and unbreakable entrepreneurial spirit.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Who are key startup people you see creating success locally, whether investors, founders or even other types of startup ecosystems roles like lawyers, designers, growth experts, etc. We\u2019re trying to highlight the movers and shakers who outsiders might not know.<\/strong><br \/>\nHard to name one or a few \u2026 every single player plays a different role and one individual is unimportant without others. Same as in nature, even the strongest\/biggest predators cannot thrive without a thriving ecosystem as a whole.<\/p>\n<hr \/>\n<p><em><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/02\/26\/techcrunch-early-stage-is-the-startup-bootcamp-youve-always-needed\/?tpcc=ECTW2020\">Early Stage<\/a> is the premier \u2018how-to\u2019 event for startup entrepreneurs and investors. You\u2019ll hear first-hand how some of the most successful founders and VCs build their businesses, raise money and manage their portfolios. We\u2019ll cover every aspect of company-building: Fundraising, recruiting, sales, product market fit, PR, marketing and brand building. Each session also has audience participation built-in \u2013 there\u2019s ample time included for audience questions and discussion. Use code \u201cTCARTICLE at checkout to get <a href=\"http:\/\/techcrunch.com\/events\/tc-early-stage-2021-part-1?promo=tcarticle&amp;display=true\">20 percent off tickets right here<\/a>.<\/em><\/p>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>The Czech Republic may be better known for beer, hockey and the sights of Prague, but its entrepreneurial community is as ambitious as any.<\/p>\n","protected":false},"author":12084669,"featured_media":2124820,"comment_status":"open","ping_status":"closed","sticky":false,"template":"","format":"standard","meta":{"outcome":"","status":"","crunchbase_tag":0,"amp_status":"","relegenceEntities":[],"relegenceSubjects":[],"carmot_uuid":"f8773d8d-535e-3770-969c-b796d933dfa6"},"categories":[449557100,20429,17396,35394854],"tags":[22733,576845179,576746498,449557042],"crunchbase_tag":[],"tc_stories_tax":[],"tc_ec_category":[],"tc_event":[],"jetpack_featured_media_url":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/GettyImages-1165184158.jpg","shortlink":"https:\/\/tcrn.ch\/3lb1qqw","rapidData":{"pt":"","pct":""},"premiumContent":false,"premiumCutoffPercent":1,"featured":false,"subtitle":"","seoTitle":"","seoDescription":"","tc_cb_mapping":[],"associatedEvent":null,"event":null,"authors":[12084669],"hide_featured_image":false,"_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts\/2124283"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/types\/post"}],"replies":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/comments?post=2124283"}],"version-history":[{"count":17,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts\/2124283\/revisions"}],"predecessor-version":[{"id":2124992,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts\/2124283\/revisions\/2124992"}],"authors":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/tc\/v1\/users\/12084669"}],"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/edit":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-admin\/post.php?post=2124283&action=edit"}],"author":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/tc\/v1\/users\/12084669"}],"wp:featuredmedia":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/media\/2124820"}],"wp:attachment":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/media?parent=2124283"}],"wp:term":[{"taxonomy":"category","embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/categories?post=2124283"},{"taxonomy":"post_tag","embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags?post=2124283"},{"taxonomy":"_tc_cb_tag_taxonomy","embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/crunchbase_tag?post=2124283"},{"taxonomy":"tc_stories_tax","embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_stories_tax?post=2124283"},{"taxonomy":"tc_ec_category","embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_ec_category?post=2124283"},{"taxonomy":"tc_event","embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_event?post=2124283"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]},"_embedded":{"authors":[{"id":12084669,"name":"Mike Butcher","url":"","description":"","link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/author\/mike-butcher\/","slug":"mike-butcher","avatar_urls":{"24":"https:\/\/secure.gravatar.com\/avatar\/ef4a4ab87c72738ed187e21de55b2fc6?s=24&d=identicon&r=g","48":"https:\/\/secure.gravatar.com\/avatar\/ef4a4ab87c72738ed187e21de55b2fc6?s=48&d=identicon&r=g","96":"https:\/\/secure.gravatar.com\/avatar\/ef4a4ab87c72738ed187e21de55b2fc6?s=96&d=identicon&r=g"},"links":{"homepage":"http:\/\/mbites.com","facebook":"https:\/\/www.facebook.com\/mikebutcher","twitter":"https:\/\/twitter.com\/mikebutcher","linkedin":"https:\/\/uk.linkedin.com\/in\/mikebutcher","crunchbase":"https:\/\/www.crunchbase.com\/person\/mike-butcher"},"position":"Editor At Large","cbDescription":"<p>Mike Butcher MBE is Editor-at-large of TechCrunch.<\/p>\n\n<p>As a writer, editor, interviewer, moderator and columnist in the tech media world he covers everything the smallest tech startups and the largest tech giants. Lately, he\u2019s been writing a lot about Blockchain and Crypto.<\/p>\n\n<p>Mike has been named one of the most influential people in European technology by various newspaper and magazines. He founded The Europas Awards, the non-profit Techfugees and has advised the UK government on tech startup policy. He was awarded an MBE in the Queen\u2019s Birthday Honours list 2016 for services to the UK technology industry and journalism.<\/p>\n\n<p>As well as being a long-time Writer, Broadcaster and Editor Mike is also co-founder of TechHub.com, a project to merge a thriving community with office space for fast-moving startups; co-founder of the UK\u2019s Coadec.com lobbyist for startups; the non-profit TechVets for UK military veterans, and the UK event series ThePathfounder.com.<\/p>\n\n<p>Mike has written for UK national newspapers and magazines including The Financial Times, The Guardian, The Times, The Daily Telegraph and The New Statesman. He is a former editor of New Media Age magazine, the leading new media weekly in the UK, and the European edition of The Industry Standard magazine.<\/p>\n\n<p>In 2000 he was nominated as NetMedia\u2019s European Internet Journalist of the Year. In 2004 he was voted \u2018One of the 100 Innovators of the UK Internet Decade\u2019 by GfK NOP, the fourth-largest custom research business in the world. In July 2008 he was put at No. 47 out of the Top 100 people in London\u2019s creative industry by The Independent newspaper and The Hospital Club. In August 2008 TechCrunch Europe was awarded the best \u201cWeb 2.0 and business blog\u201d in the UK, by the readers of Computer Weekly magazine. In 2009 it was named as one of the Top 10 blogs out of the UK. Also in 2009 Mike was named one of the Top 10 bloggers on Twitter in the UK. In October 2009 he was named one of the Top 50 most influential Britons in technology by The Daily Telegraph. In April 2010 he was in Wired UK\u2019s Top 100 influencer list, in 2011, in 2012, (there was no Top 100 list in 2013), in 2014 and again in 2015. In April 2010 TechCrunch Europe was shortlisted in the Specialist Digital Publisher category of the prestigious UK-based Association of Online Publishers\u2019 Digital Publishing Awards. In November 2010 he was named as one of London\u2019s most influential people in New Media and \u201cking of dotcom commentators\u201d by The Evening Standard Newspaper. He has been listed as one of the Top 100 most influential people on Twitter in the UK. He was named in the TechNation200 Almanac. He has been named as one of \u201cThe 100 coolest people in UK tech\u201d by Business Insider. He was named in the \u201cSmith & Williamson Power 100\u201d. In 2016 British GQ magazine named him one of the 100 Most Connected Men in the UK. He has spoken at the prestigious World Economic Forum, the Monaco Media Forum, Le Web, Web Summit and DLD among many other conferences. Mike is a regular commentator on the technology business, appearing on BBC News, Sky News, CNBC, Channel 4, Al Jazeera and Bloomberg. Mike has advised the UK Prime Minister on tech startups, served on the Mayor of London\u2019s Digital Advisory Board, the \u2018Smart London\u2019 Board and been a Technology Ambassador for London. He was awarded an MBE in the Queen\u2019s Birthday Honours list 2016 for services to the UK technology industry and journalism. Mike\u2019s personal blog is mbites.com, while he Tweets as @mikebutcher.<\/p>\n\n<p>He owns shares in ETFs, shares in Verizon via employee stock grants and small amounts of various cryptocurrencies.\nMore info: http:\/\/mbites.com\/contact<\/p>","cbAvatar":false,"twitter":"mikebutcher","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/tc\/v1\/users\/12084669"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/tc\/v1\/users"}]}}],"author":[{"id":12084669,"name":"Mike Butcher","url":"","description":"","link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/author\/mike-butcher\/","slug":"mike-butcher","avatar_urls":{"24":"https:\/\/secure.gravatar.com\/avatar\/ef4a4ab87c72738ed187e21de55b2fc6?s=24&d=identicon&r=g","48":"https:\/\/secure.gravatar.com\/avatar\/ef4a4ab87c72738ed187e21de55b2fc6?s=48&d=identicon&r=g","96":"https:\/\/secure.gravatar.com\/avatar\/ef4a4ab87c72738ed187e21de55b2fc6?s=96&d=identicon&r=g"},"links":{"homepage":"http:\/\/mbites.com","facebook":"https:\/\/www.facebook.com\/mikebutcher","twitter":"https:\/\/twitter.com\/mikebutcher","linkedin":"https:\/\/uk.linkedin.com\/in\/mikebutcher","crunchbase":"https:\/\/www.crunchbase.com\/person\/mike-butcher"},"position":"Editor At Large","cbDescription":"<p>Mike Butcher MBE is Editor-at-large of TechCrunch.<\/p>\n\n<p>As a writer, editor, interviewer, moderator and columnist in the tech media world he covers everything the smallest tech startups and the largest tech giants. Lately, he\u2019s been writing a lot about Blockchain and Crypto.<\/p>\n\n<p>Mike has been named one of the most influential people in European technology by various newspaper and magazines. He founded The Europas Awards, the non-profit Techfugees and has advised the UK government on tech startup policy. He was awarded an MBE in the Queen\u2019s Birthday Honours list 2016 for services to the UK technology industry and journalism.<\/p>\n\n<p>As well as being a long-time Writer, Broadcaster and Editor Mike is also co-founder of TechHub.com, a project to merge a thriving community with office space for fast-moving startups; co-founder of the UK\u2019s Coadec.com lobbyist for startups; the non-profit TechVets for UK military veterans, and the UK event series ThePathfounder.com.<\/p>\n\n<p>Mike has written for UK national newspapers and magazines including The Financial Times, The Guardian, The Times, The Daily Telegraph and The New Statesman. He is a former editor of New Media Age magazine, the leading new media weekly in the UK, and the European edition of The Industry Standard magazine.<\/p>\n\n<p>In 2000 he was nominated as NetMedia\u2019s European Internet Journalist of the Year. In 2004 he was voted \u2018One of the 100 Innovators of the UK Internet Decade\u2019 by GfK NOP, the fourth-largest custom research business in the world. In July 2008 he was put at No. 47 out of the Top 100 people in London\u2019s creative industry by The Independent newspaper and The Hospital Club. In August 2008 TechCrunch Europe was awarded the best \u201cWeb 2.0 and business blog\u201d in the UK, by the readers of Computer Weekly magazine. In 2009 it was named as one of the Top 10 blogs out of the UK. Also in 2009 Mike was named one of the Top 10 bloggers on Twitter in the UK. In October 2009 he was named one of the Top 50 most influential Britons in technology by The Daily Telegraph. In April 2010 he was in Wired UK\u2019s Top 100 influencer list, in 2011, in 2012, (there was no Top 100 list in 2013), in 2014 and again in 2015. In April 2010 TechCrunch Europe was shortlisted in the Specialist Digital Publisher category of the prestigious UK-based Association of Online Publishers\u2019 Digital Publishing Awards. In November 2010 he was named as one of London\u2019s most influential people in New Media and \u201cking of dotcom commentators\u201d by The Evening Standard Newspaper. He has been listed as one of the Top 100 most influential people on Twitter in the UK. He was named in the TechNation200 Almanac. He has been named as one of \u201cThe 100 coolest people in UK tech\u201d by Business Insider. He was named in the \u201cSmith & Williamson Power 100\u201d. In 2016 British GQ magazine named him one of the 100 Most Connected Men in the UK. He has spoken at the prestigious World Economic Forum, the Monaco Media Forum, Le Web, Web Summit and DLD among many other conferences. Mike is a regular commentator on the technology business, appearing on BBC News, Sky News, CNBC, Channel 4, Al Jazeera and Bloomberg. Mike has advised the UK Prime Minister on tech startups, served on the Mayor of London\u2019s Digital Advisory Board, the \u2018Smart London\u2019 Board and been a Technology Ambassador for London. He was awarded an MBE in the Queen\u2019s Birthday Honours list 2016 for services to the UK technology industry and journalism. Mike\u2019s personal blog is mbites.com, while he Tweets as @mikebutcher.<\/p>\n\n<p>He owns shares in ETFs, shares in Verizon via employee stock grants and small amounts of various cryptocurrencies.\nMore info: illion-valuation\/","title":{"rendered":"Tiger Global in talks to invest in young Indian social network at $170M valuation"},"content":{"rendered":"<p id=\"speakable-summary\">Who says there is no room for a new social network?<\/p>\n<p>Tiger Global is in advanced stages of talks to lead a round of $15 million to $20 million in seven-month-old Kutumb that values the Indian startup at about $170 million, four people familiar with the matter told TechCrunch.<\/p>\n<p>The American investment firm has offered a termsheet to the Indian startup but the deal &#8212; a Series A &#8212; has not closed yet, some of the people said on the condition of anonymity as the talks are private. Usual caveat: Terms may change, or the deal may not materialize.<\/p><div class=\"piano-inline-promo\"><\/div>\n<p><a href=\"http:\/\/kutumbapp.com\/\">Kutumb<\/a>, which means family in Hindi, has built a \u201cprivate social network like Reddit\u201d that connects communities based on \u201cculture, creed, beliefs, interests, [and] professions.\u201d<\/p>\n<p>The startup&#8217;s eponymous six-month-old app has amassed over 11 million monthly active users, up from about 550,000 in December last year, according to mobile insight firm App Annie (data of which an industry executive shared with TechCrunch).<\/p>\n<p>Kutumb was valued at about $15 million late last year when it raised funds from Sequoia Capital India\u2019s Surge accelerator. It raised about $2.5 million in its seed financing round, according to insight firm Tracxn.<\/p>\n<p>Tiger Global declined to comment. One of the co-founders of Kutumb didn\u2019t respond to a request for comment.<\/p>\n<hr \/>\n<p><em><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/02\/26\/techcrunch-early-stage-is-the-startup-bootcamp-youve-always-needed\/?tpcc=ECTW2020\">Early Stage<\/a> is the premier \u2018how-to\u2019 event for startup entrepreneurs and investors. You\u2019ll hear first-hand how some of the most successful founders and VCs build their businesses, raise money and manage their portfolios. We\u2019ll cover every aspect of company-building: Fundraising, recruiting, sales, product market fit, PR, marketing and brand building. Each session also has audience participation built-in \u2013 there\u2019s ample time included for audience questions and discussion. Use code \u201cTCARTICLE at checkout to get <a href=\"http:\/\/techcrunch.com\/events\/tc-early-stage-2021-part-1?promo=tcarticle&amp;display=true\">20 percent off tickets right here<\/a>.<\/em><\/p>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>Who says there is no room for a new social network? Tiger Global is in advanced stages of talks to lead a round of $15 million to $20 million in seven-month-old Kutumb that values the Indian startup at about $170 million, four people familiar with the matter told TechCrunch. The American investment firm has offered [&hellip;]<\/p>\n","protected":false},"author":133574269,"featured_media":2085436,"comment_status":"open","ping_status":"closed","sticky":false,"template":"","format":"standard","meta":{"outcome":"","status":"","crunchbase_tag":0,"amp_status":"","relegenceEntities":[],"relegenceSubjects":[],"carmot_uuid":"4ceb0385-6eb2-36a7-ae32-afd0ba216177"},"categories":[449557102,449557111,3457],"tags":[3054,12192651],"crunchbase_tag":[],"tc_stories_tax":[],"tc_ec_category":[],"tc_event":[],"jetpack_featured_media_url":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/12\/GettyImages-1219601702.jpg","shortlink":"https:\/\/tcrn.ch\/3eAD1tk","rapidData":{"pt":"","pct":""},"premiumContent":false,"premiumCutoffPercent":1,"featured":false,"subtitle":"","seoTitle":"","seoDescription":"","tc_cb_mapping":[],"associatedEvent":null,"event":null,"authors":[133574269],"hide_featured_image":false,"_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts\/2124612"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/types\/post"}],"replies":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/comments?post=2124612"}],"version-history":[{"count":9,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts\/2124612\/revisions"}],"predecessor-version":[{"id":2124951,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts\/2124612\/revisions\/2124951"}],"authors":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/tc\/v1\/users\/133574269"}],"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/edit":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-admin\/post.php?post=2124612&action=edit"}],"author":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/tc\/v1\/users\/133574269"}],"wp:featuredmedia":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/media\/2085436"}],"wp:attachment":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/media?parent=2124612"}],"wp:term":[{" ia-gallery?categories=449557111"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?categories=449557111"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}},{"id":3457,"link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/social\/","name":"Social","slug":"social","taxonomy":"category","parent":0,"rapidData":{"pt":"","pct":""},"submenu_categories":[],"_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/categories\/3457"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/categories"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/category"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?categories=3457"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?categories=3457"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?categories=3457"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}}],[{"id":3054,"link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/tag\/india\/","name":"india","slug":"india","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/3054"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=3054"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=3054"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=3054"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=3054"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}},{"id":12192651,"link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/tag\/tiger-global\/","name":"tiger global","slug":"tiger-global","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/12192651"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=12192651"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=12192651"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=12192651"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=12192651"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}}],[],[],[],[]]}},{"id":2124803,"date":"2021-03-12T17:08:30","date_gmt":"2021-03-13T01:08:30","guid":{"rendered":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/?p=2124803"},"modified":"2021-03-15T04:26:28","modified_gmt":"2021-03-15T11:26:28","slug":"apple-discontinues-original-homepod-will-focus-on-mini","status":"publish","type":"post","link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/12\/apple-discontinues-original-homepod-will-focus-on-mini\/","title":{"rendered":"Apple discontinues original HomePod, will focus on mini"},"content":{"rendered":"<p id=\"speakable-summary\">Apple has discontinued its original HomePod after four years. It says that it will continue to produce and focus on the HomePod mini, introduced last year. The larger HomePod offered a beefier sound space but the mini has been very well received and clearly accomplishes many of the duties that the larger version was tasked with. The sound is super solid (especially for the size) and it offers access to Siri, Apple&#8217;s assistant feature.<\/p>\n<p>The original HomePod was a feat of audio engineering that Apple spent over five years developing. In order to accomplish its development, the team at Apple built out a full development center near its headquarters in Cupertino, with a world-class development environment with a dozen anechoic chambers, including one of the bigger anechoic chambers outside of academic use in the US. I visited the center before its release, noting that Apple took it the extra mile to get the incredibly complex series of tweeters and woofer that built its soundspace:<\/p>\n<blockquote><p>But slathered on top of that is a bunch of typically Apple extra-mile jelly. Apple says that its largest test chamber is one of the biggest in the US, on a pad, suspended from the outside world with nothing to pollute its tests of audio purity. Beyond testing for the acoustic qualities of the speaker, these chambers allowed Apple to burrow down to account for and mitigate the issues that typically arise from having a high excursion subwoofer in such a small cabinet. Going even further, there are smaller chambers that allow them to isolate the hum from electronic components (there is a computer on board after all) and make attempts to insulate and control that noise so it doesn\u2019t show up in the final output.<\/p><\/blockquote><div class=\"piano-inline-promo\"><\/div>\n<p>I found it to be one of the <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2018\/02\/06\/a-four-sentence-homepod-review-with-appendices\/\">best speakers ever made<\/a> for the home when I reviewed it in 2018. From the booming base and well-shaped nature of the tweeter assembly inside; the cloth cover that was specially shaped to avoid interfering with sound quality in any way; the way that it sensed the way that audio was being shaped by walls and other obstructions and adjusted its output to compensate. It was the definition of &#8216;no effort spared&#8217; in the speaker department.<\/p>\n<p>The major gripe for the speaker at the time was the $349 price, which was at the top end of the home speaker market, especially those with embedded home assistants. A price drop to $299 mitigated that somewhat, but still put it at the top of the pricing umbrella for the class. Apple&#8217;s HomePod mini, launched last year, has been well received. Our Brian Heater said that it had &#8216;<a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2020\/11\/12\/apple-homepod-mini-review-remarkably-big-sound\/\">remarkably big sound&#8217; for the $99 price.<\/a><\/p>\n<p>Apple gave TechCrunch a statement about the discontinuation:<\/p>\n<blockquote><p>HomePod mini has been a hit since its debut last fall, offering customers amazing sound, an intelligent assistant, and smart home control all for just $99. We are focusing our efforts on HomePod mini. We are discontinuing the original HomePod, it will continue to be available while supplies last through the Apple Online Store, Apple Retail Stores, and Apple Authorized Resellers. Apple will provide HomePod customers with software updates and service and support through Apple Care.<\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p>Existing HomePods will continue to be sold but Apple&#8217;s website is already out of Space Gray. It will continue to provide support for existing HomePods. Apple seems to be betting on the mini going forward, which could point to their desire to fill every room with &#8216;good enough&#8217; sound rather than to focus on the living room with &#8216;truly unbelievable&#8217; sound. The HomePod itself never quite got to the level where it could act as a full home theater replacement, though paired in their multi-speaker configurations.<\/p>\n<p>The HomePod research and production efforts will live on in some ways through Apple&#8217;s advanced audio rendering systems that led to things like Spatial Audio in AirPods. I quite enjoy the ones in my home and have yet to add any minis to the mix. Maybe a last minute hunt is in order.<\/p>\n<hr \/>\n<p><em><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/02\/26\/techcrunch-early-stage-is-the-startup-bootcamp-youve-always-needed\/?tpcc=ECTW2020\">Early Stage<\/a> is the premier \u2018how-to\u2019 event for startup entrepreneurs and investors. You\u2019ll hear first-hand how some of the most successful founders and VCs build their businesses, raise money and manage their portfolios. We\u2019ll cover every aspect of company-building: Fundraising, recruiting, sales, product market fit, PR, marketing and brand building. Each session also has audience participation built-in \u2013 there\u2019s ample time included for audience questions and discussion. Use code \u201cTCARTICLE at checkout to get <a href=\"http:\/\/techcrunch.com\/events\/tc-early-stage-2021-part-1?promo=tcarticle&amp;display=true\">20 percent off tickets right here<\/a>.<\/em><\/p>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>Apple has discontinued its original HomePod after four years. It says that it will continue to produce and focus on the HomePod mini, introduced last year. The larger HomePod offered a beefier sound space but the mini has been very well received and clearly accomplishes many of the duties that the larger version was tasked [&hellip;]<\/p>\n","protected":false},"author":8683986,"featured_media":1595010,"comment_status":"open","ping_status":"closed","sticky":false,"template":"","format":"standard","meta":{"outcome":"","status":"","crunchbase_tag":0,"amp_status":"","relegenceEntities":[],"relegenceSubjects":[],"carmot_uuid":"c95bf715-31a0-3c5f-a001-b44425715543"},"categories":[17396],"tags":[449553110,291,610285,43124,22538,262,9457,89915253,576594947,8616835,749755,576597523,134896,449557049],"crunchbase_tag":[],"tc_stories_tax":[],"tc_ec_category":[],"tc_event":[],"jetpack_featured_media_url":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/02\/img_9267.jpg","shortlink":"https:\/\/tcrn.ch\/38AaksH","rapidData":{"pt":"","pct":""},"premiumContent":false,"premiumCutoffPercent":1,"featured":false,"subtitle":"","seoTitle":"","seoDescription":"","tc_cb_mapping":[],"associatedEvent":null,"event":null,"authors":[8683986],"hide_featured_image":false,"_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts\/2124803"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/types\/post"}],"replies":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/comments?post=2124803"}],"version-history":[{"count":4,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts\/2124803\/revisions"}],"predecessor-version":[{"id":2124952,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts\/2124803\/revisions\/2124952"}],"authors":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/tc\/v1\/users\/8683986"}],"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/edit":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-admin\/post.php?post=2124803&action=edit"}],"author":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/tc\/v1\/users\/8683986"}],"wp:featuredmedia":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/media\/1595010"}],"wp:attachment":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-jso Panzarino","url":"","description":"","link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/author\/matthew-panzarino\/","slug":"matthew-panzarino","avatar_urls":{"24":"https:\/\/secure.gravatar.com\/avatar\/b801d387d4af3749fed05f0f2e82690f?s=24&d=identicon&r=g","48":"https:\/\/secure.gravatar.com\/avatar\/b801d387d4af3749fed05f0f2e82690f?s=48&d=identicon&r=g","96":"https:\/\/secure.gravatar.com\/avatar\/b801d387d4af3749fed05f0f2e82690f?s=96&d=identicon&r=g"},"links":{"facebook":"http:\/\/www.facebook.com\/matthew.panzarino","twitter":"https:\/\/twitter.com\/panzer","linkedin":"https:\/\/www.linkedin.com\/in\/matthewpanzarino","homepage":"","crunchbase":"https:\/\/www.crunchbase.com\/person\/matthew-panzarino"},"position":"Editor-in-Chief","cbDescription":"<p>Matthew
