He has served as News Editor and Managing Editor at The Next Web and is now Editor-In-Chief at TechCrunch.<\/p>\r\n\r\n<p>He has made a name for himself in the tech media world as a writer and editor, relentlessly covering Apple and Twitter, in addition to a broad range of startups in the fields of robotics, computer vision, AI, fashion, VR, AR and more. Owns shares in ETFs.\r\nContact Matthew at matthew@techcrunch.com\r\nPGP Key: https:\/\/keybase.io\/panzer<\/p>","cbAvatar":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/01\/imwirxrms5q8vnvevunf.png.png","twitter":"panzer","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/tc\/v1\/users\/8683986"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/tc\/v1\/users"}]}}],"wp:featuredmedia":[{"id":1595010,"date":"2018-02-06T05:26:13","slug":"img_9267-2","type":"attachment","link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2018\/02\/06\/a-four-sentence-homepod-review-with-appendices\/img_9267-2\/","title":{"rendered":"homepod"},"author":8683986,"license":"","authors":[8683986],"caption":{"rendered":""},"alt_text":"","media_type":"image","mime_type":"image\/jpeg","media_details":{"width":5184,"height":3456,"file":"2018\/02\/img_9267.jpg","sizes":{"thumbnail":{"file":"img_9267.jpg?resize=150,100","width":150,"height":100,"mime_type":"image\/jpeg","source_url":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/02\/img_9267.jpg?w=150"},"medium":{"file":"img_9267.jpg?resize=300,200","width":300,"height":200,"mime_type":"image\/jpeg","source_url":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/02\/img_9267.jpg?w=300"},"medium_large":{"file":"img_9267.jpg?resize=768,512","width":768,"height":512,"mime_type":"image\/jpeg","source_url":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/02\/img_9267.jpg?w=1024"},"large":{"file":"img_9267.jpg?resize=680,453","width":680,"height":453,"mime_type":"image\/jpeg","source_url":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/02\/img_9267.jpg?w=680"},"1536x1536":{"file":"img_9267.jpg?resize=1536,1024","width":1536,"height":1024,"mime_type":"image\/jpeg","source_url":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/02\/img_9267.jpg?w=1536"},"2048x2048":{"file":"img_9267.jpg?resize=2048,1365","width":2048,"height":1365,"mime_type":"image\/jpeg","source_url":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/02\/img_9267.jpg?w=2048"},"guest-author-32":{"file":"img_9267.jpg?resize=32,32","width":32,"height":32,"mime_type":"image\/jpeg","source_url":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/02\/img_9267.jpg?w=32&h=32&crop=1"},"guest-author-50":{"file":"img_9267.jpg?resize=50,50","width":50,"height":50,"mime_type":"image\/jpeg","source_url":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/02\/img_9267.jpg?w=50&h=50&crop=1"},"guest-author-64":{"file":"img_9267.jpg?resize=64,64","width":64,"height":64,"mime_type":"image\/jpeg","source_url":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/02\/img_9267.jpg?w=64&h=64&crop=1"},"guest-author-96":{"file":"img_9267.jpg?resize=96,96","width":96,"height":96,"mime_type":"image\/jpeg","source_url":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/02\/img_9267.jpg?w=96&h=96&crop=1"},"guest-author-128":{"file":"img_9267.jpg?resize=128,128","width":128,"height":128,"mime_type":"image\/jpeg","source_url":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/02\/img_9267.jpg?w=128&h=128&crop=1"},"concierge-thumb":{"file":"img_9267.jpg?resize=50,33","width":50,"height":33,"mime_type":"image\/jpeg","source_url":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/02\/img_9267.jpg?w=50"},"full":{"file":"img_9267.jpg","width":1024,"height":683,"mime_type":"image\/jpeg","source_url":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/02\/img_9267.jpg"}},"image_meta":{"aperture":"2.8","credit":"","camera":"Canon eld-companies?tags=22538"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=22538"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=22538"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}},{"id":262,"link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/tag\/computing\/","name":"computing","slug":"computing","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/262"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=262"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=262"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=262"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=262"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}},{"id":9457,"link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/tag\/cupertino\/","name":"cupertino","slug":"cupertino","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/9457"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=9457"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=9457"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=9457"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=9457"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}},{"id":89915253,"link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/tag\/homekit\/","name":"HomeKit","slug":"homekit","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/89915253"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=89915253"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=89915253"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=89915253"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=89915253"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}},{"id":576594947,"link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/tag\/homepod\/","name":"HomePod","slug":"homepod","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/576594947"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=576594947"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=576594947"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=576594947"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=576594947"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}},{"id":8616835,"link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/tag\/intelligent-assistant\/","name":"intelligent assistant","slug":"intelligent-assistant","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/8616835"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=8616835"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=8616835"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=8616835"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=8616835"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}}],[],[],[],[]]}},{"id":2124668,"date":"2021-03-12T16:54:14","date_gmt":"2021-03-13T00:54:14","guid":{"rendered":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/?p=2124668"},"modified":"2021-03-15T04:26:42","modified_gmt":"2021-03-15T11:26:42","slug":"vc-democratization","status":"publish","type":"post","link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/12\/vc-democratization\/","title":{"rendered":"Crowdfunding limits are poised to change next week, but most VCs aren&#8217;t paying attention &#8212; yet"},"content":{"rendered":"<p id=\"speakable-summary\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.passioncapital.com\/\">Passion Capital<\/a>, the early-stage venture firm in London, told TechCrunch earlier this week that &#8212; in an apparent first for a European fund &#8212;\u00a0 it <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/09\/in-a-first-for-europe-passion-capital-will-crowd-fund-part-of-its-new-62m-fund-from-retail-investors\/\">plans to crowdfund<\/a> the final stage of its third and latest vehicle. Specifically, it\u2019s carving out around half a million dollars for anyone who wants to invest in the vehicle, as long as they are a high net worth individual.<\/p>\n<p>Firm founder Eileen Burbidge says the outfit was inspired by developments it has seen here in the U.S., from AngelList&#8217;s <a href=\"https:\/\/angel.co\/blog\/rolling-venture-fund-launch\">rolling fund<\/a> program, to an imminent change in a crowdfunding regulation, Reg CF, that <a href=\"https:\/\/www.crowdfundinsider.com\/2021\/01\/171249-after-long-wait-updates-to-crowdfunding-exemptions-publish-in-federal-register-with-new-rules-effective-in-march\/\">on Monday<\/a> is set to bump up the maximum amount that can be raised through a crowdfunding campaign from $1.07 million in any twelve-month period to $5 million &#8212; a nearly five-fold increase.<\/p>\n<p>The move is interesting, especially coming on the heels of some other <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/02\/05\/two-new-efforts-push-to-transform-more-people-into-limited-partners-of-vc-funds\/\">recent initiatives<\/a> to democratize venture capital. But if crowdfunding a piece of traditional venture funds does become a bigger trend, it\u2019s not going to happen overnight. We talked with fund formation attorneys and administrators this week, and they\u2019d barely registered that the crowdfunding limit is about to quintuple because they aren&#8217;t being asked about it.<\/p><div class=\"piano-inline-promo\"><\/div>\n<p>Why not? One fund formation attorney said he doesn\u2019t think it will become a viable fundraising path &#8212; unless other paths aren\u2019t available &#8212; because of the benefits of having investors who can provide contacts and expertise to portfolio companies. Think of the many funds that count CTOs as limited partners, for example; VCs can learn a lot about the kinds of technology they&#8217;re looking to implement by bringing them into the fold.<\/p>\n<p>There are other pragmatic concerns, too. VCs like to personally know their limited partners because they call down capital on a deal-by-deal basis and want to be sure their investors will come through with the money.<\/p>\n<p>A crowdfunded component could also be a &#8220;big\u00a0 and permanent administrative burden,&#8221; given that it could involve &#8220;potentially hundreds of equity owners for a relatively small amount of money.&#8221; So notes attorney Mike Sullivan of the global law firm Orrick.<\/p>\n<p>A less obvious reason VCs might not be thinking much about crowdfunding ties to complications when it comes to a firm\u2019s internal rate of return. VCs don\u2019t like to have money sitting around on their balance sheet; they like to call down the capital as they need it, because the clock doesn\u2019t start ticking on an investment until they do this. (That gives them more time to hopefully shepherd an investment into an eventual success story that they can later tweet about.)<\/p>\n<p>Asked about why the new crowdfunding cap isn&#8217;t on his colleagues&#8217; radar yet, one fund administrator tells us it&#8217;s because they&#8217;re all too busy dealing with with SPACs, those special purpose acquisition companies that are springing up like <a href=\"https:\/\/www.wsj.com\/articles\/the-spac-boom-visualized-in-one-chart-11612962000\">mushrooms<\/a>.<\/p>\n<p>That many of these blank-check outfits are taking public fairly nascent tech companies &#8212; giving retail investors access to the kinds of high-risk, high-reward startups that be otherwise out of reach &#8212;\u00a0 could also slow the extent to which VCs begin incorporating more &#8220;ordinary&#8221; investors into the asset class.<\/p>\n<p>Still, absent a last-minute change by the Biden administration &#8212; and it doesn&#8217;t that appear one is coming (at least, Gary Gensler&#8217;s nomination to serve as SEC chairman still requires full Senate confirmation) &#8212; Reg CF is on the cusp of changing.<\/p>\n<p>It&#8217;s worth paying closer attention to what ripple effects &#8212; and opportunities &#8212; might result.<\/p>\n<hr \/>\n<p><em><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/02\/26\/techcrunch-early-stage-is-the-startup-bootcamp-youve-always-needed\/?tpcc=ECTW2020\">Early Stage<\/a> is the premier \u2018how-to\u2019 event for startup entrepreneurs and investors. You\u2019ll hear first-hand how some of the most successful founders and VCs build their businesses, raise money and manage their portfolios. We\u2019ll cover every aspect of company-building: Fundraising, recruiting, sales, product market fit, PR, marketing and brand building. Each session also has audience participation built-in \u2013 there\u2019s ample time included for audience questions and discussion. Use code \u201cTCARTICLE at checkout to get <a href=\"http:\/\/techcrunch.com\/events\/tc-early-stage-2021-part-1?promo=tcarticle&amp;display=true\">20 percent off tickets right here<\/a>.<\/em><\/p>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>Passion Capital, the early-stage venture firm in London, told TechCrunch earlier this week that &#8212; in an apparent first for a European fund &#8212;\u00a0 it plans to crowdfund the final stage of its third and latest vehicle. Specifically, it\u2019s carving out around half a million dollars for anyone who wants to invest in the vehicle, Crunch roundup: Coupang and Roblox debut, driving GPT-3 adoption, startup how-tos, more"},"content":{"rendered":"<p id=\"speakable-summary\">Extra Crunch publishes a variety of article types, but how-tos are my favorite category.<\/p>\n<p>For many entrepreneurs, the startup they are trying to get off the ground might be only the second entry on their resume. As a result, they don&#8217;t have much experience to draw from when it comes to basics like hiring, fundraising and growth marketing.<\/p>\n<p>Last week, Natasha Mascarenhas interviewed experts who had some strategic advice for finding the right time <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/05\/product-manager-hiring-for-startups\/\">to bring a product manager on board<\/a>. This afternoon, we published a guest post by growth marketer Jessica Li with tips for &#8220;<a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/12\/how-nontechnical-talent-can-break-into-deep-tech\/\">how nontechnical talent can build relationships with deep tech companies<\/a>.&#8221;<\/p><div class=\"piano-inline-promo\"><\/div>\n<p>We&#8217;ve also received great feedback on a recent guest post about <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/02\/six-tips-for-saas-founders-who-dont-want-vc-money\/\">bootstrapping options for SaaS founders<\/a> written by a founder who&#8217;s actually done it.<\/p>\n<hr \/>\n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><i>Full Extra Crunch articles are only available to members.<br \/>\n<a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/subscribe\/\">Use discount code <strong>ECFriday<\/strong><\/a> to save 20% off a one- or two-year subscription.<\/i><\/p>\n<hr \/>\n<p>If you have some startup-related &#8220;how&#8221; and &#8220;why&#8221; questions, please browse our <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/tag\/ec-how-to\/\">Extra Crunch How To stories<\/a>. They&#8217;re aimed squarely at early-stage founders and workers trying to solve long-term problems.<\/p>\n<p>Thanks very much for reading Extra Crunch this week! I hope you have a relaxing weekend.<\/p>\n<p>Walter Thompson<br \/>\nSenior Editor, TechCrunch<br \/>\n<a href=\"https:\/\/www.twitter.com\/yourprotagonist\">@yourprotagonist<\/a><\/p>\n<h2>Welcome to Bloxburg, public investors<\/h2>\n<p><div id=\"attachment_1854385\" style=\"width: 1034px\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><img aria-describedby=\"caption-attachment-1854385\" loading=\"lazy\" class=\"size-full wp-image-1854385\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2019\/07\/GettyImages-1027412388.jpg\" alt=\"SAN FRANCISCO, CA - SEPTEMBER 05: Roblox Corporation Founder and CEO David Baszucki speaks onstage during Day 1 of TechCrunch Disrupt SF 2018 at Moscone Center on September 5, 2018 in San Francisco, California.\" width=\"1024\" height=\"681\" srcset=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2019\/07\/GettyImages-1027412388.jpg 3782w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2019\/07\/GettyImages-1027412388.jpg?resize=150,100 150w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2019\/07\/GettyImages-1027412388.jpg?resize=300,200 300w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2019\/07\/GettyImages-1027412388.jpg?resize=768,511 768w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2019\/07\/GettyImages-1027412388.jpg?resize=680,452 680w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2019\/07\/GettyImages-1027412388.jpg?resize=1536,1022 1536w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2019\/07\/GettyImages-1027412388.jpg?resize=2048,1362 2048w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2019\/07\/GettyImages-1027412388.jpg?resize=50,33 50w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px\" \/><p id=\"caption-attachment-1854385\" class=\"wp-caption-text\"><strong>Image Credits:\u00a0<\/strong>Steve Jennings\u00a0\/\u00a0Getty Images<\/p><\/div><\/p>\n<p>As Roblox began to trade Wednesday, the company\u2019s shares shot above its reference price of $45 per share. Roblox, a gaming company aimed at children, has had a tumultuous if exciting path to the public markets.<\/p>\n<p>Seeing Roblox trade so very far above its direct listing reference price and final private valuation appears to undercut the argument that this sort of debut can sort out pricing issues inherent in more traditional IPOs.<\/p>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"Jjdmmy2Ync\"><p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/10\/welcome-to-bloxburg-public-investors\/\">Welcome to Bloxburg, public investors<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p><iframe class=\"wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" data-secret=\"Jjdmmy2Ync\" width=\"800\" height=\"450\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n<h2><\/h2>\n<h2>4 ways startups will drive GPT-3 adoption in 2021<\/h2>\n<p><div id=\"attachment_2122479\" style=\"width: 1034px\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><img aria-describedby=\"caption-attachment-2122479\" loading=\"lazy\" height=\"682\" srcset=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/GettyImages-875579516.jpg 1400w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/GettyImages-875579516.jpg?resize=150,100 150w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/GettyImages-875579516.jpg?resize=300,200 300w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/GettyImages-875579516.jpg?resize=680,453 680w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/GettyImages-875579516.jpg?resize=50,33 50w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px\" \/><p id=\"caption-attachment-2122479\" class=\"wp-caption-text\"><strong>Image Credits:<\/strong> <a href=\"https:\/\/www.gettyimages.com\/search\/photographer?family=creative&amp;photographer=Andrii+Zastrozhnov\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Zastrozhnov <span class=\"screen-reader-text\">(opens in a new window)<\/span><\/a> \/ Getty Images<\/p><\/div><\/p>\n<p>Trained on trillions of words, GPT-3 is a 175-billion parameter transformer model \u2014 the third of such models released by OpenAI.<\/p>\n<p>GPT-3 is remarkable in its ability to generate human-like text and responses, able to return coherent and topical emails, tweets, trivia and much more. In 2021, this technology will power the launch of a thousand new startups and applications.<\/p>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"iyT4ccFdsu\"><p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/09\/4-ways-startups-will-drive-gpt-3-adoption-in-2021\/\">4 ways startups will drive GPT-3 adoption in 2021<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p><iframe class=\"wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" title=\"&#8220;4 marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n<h2><\/h2>\n<h2>There have never been more $100M+ fintech rounds than right now<\/h2>\n<p><div id=\"attachment_1996007\" class=\"wp-caption-text\"><strong>Image Credits:<\/strong> <a href=\"https:\/\/www.nigelsussman.com\/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Nigel Sussman <span class=\"screen-reader-text\">(opens in a new window)<\/span><\/a><\/p><\/div><\/p>\n<p>We are in a period of all-time record investment for so-called mega-rounds, or investments of $100 million or more inside the fintech realm.<\/p>\n<p>To date, Q1 2021 is ahead and is thus guaranteed to set a new record, having already bested the preceding all-time high. What\u2019s going on?<\/p>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"EJL6JKqqDX\"><p><a frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n<h2><\/h2>\n<h2>Global-e files to go public as e-commerce startups enjoy a renaissance<\/h2>\n<p><div new window)<\/span><\/a><\/p><\/div><\/p>\n<p>Global-e, an e-commerce platform that helps online sellers reach global consumers, filed to go public on Tuesday. Global-e\u2019s business exploded amid the pandemic in 2020, and the company expects that the COVID-fueled shift to e-commerce will only lead to future growth.<\/p>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"pcqPS3dlX3\"><p><a height=\"450\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n<p>&nbsp;<\/p>\n<h2>Passive collaboration is essential to remote work\u2019s long-term success<\/h2>\n<p><div id=\"attachment_2123721\" style=\"width: 1034px\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><img aria-describedby=\"caption-attachment-2123721\" loading=\"lazy\" class=\"size-full class=\"wp-caption-text\"><strong>Image Credits:<\/strong> <a href=\"https:\/\/www.gettyimages.com\/search\/photographer?family=creative&amp;photographer=Alistair+Berg\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Alistair Berg <span class=\"screen-reader-text\">(opens in a new window)<\/span><\/a> \/ Getty Images<\/p><\/div><\/p>\n<p>Have you ever popped into a meeting because you overheard a snippet of a conversation and wanted to share your perspective?<\/p>\n<p>That\u2019s passive collaboration &#8212; low-friction ways to invite new ideas. But it\u2019s only when we\u2019re able to fully realize passive collaboration virtually that we\u2019ll have unlocked the full potential of remote and hybrid work situations.<\/p>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"DNDAxh2izJ\"><p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/10\/passive-collaboration-is-essential-to-remote-works-long-term-success\/\">Passive collaboration is essential to remote work&#8217;s long-term frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n<p>&nbsp;<\/p>\n<h2>Dear Sophie: What are the pros and cons of the H-1B, O-1A and EB-1A?<\/h2>\n<p><div class=\"wp-caption-text\"><strong>Image Credits:<\/strong> Bryce Durbin\/TechCrunch<\/p><\/div><\/p>\n<p><strong>Dear Sophie:<\/strong><\/p>\n<p><strong>I\u2019m an entrepreneur who wants to expand my startup to the U.S. What are the benefits and drawbacks of various types of visas and green cards?<\/strong><\/p>\n<p><strong>The ones I\u2019ve heard the most about are the H-1B, O-1 and EB-1A.<\/strong><\/p>\n<p><strong>\u2014 Intelligent in India<\/strong><\/p>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"FbGbfE6NEf\"><p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/10\/dear-sophie-what-are-the-pros-and-cons-of-the-h-1b-o-1a-and-eb-1a\/\">Dear Sophie: What are the pros and cons of the H-1B, O-1A and EB-1A?<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p><iframe class=\"wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n<p>&nbsp;<\/p>\n<h2>Proactive CEOs should prioritize European expansion<\/h2>\n<p><div id=\"attachment_2123284\" style=\"width: 1034px\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><img aria-describedby=\"caption-attachment-2123284\" loading=\"lazy\" class=\"size-full wp-image-2123284\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/GettyImages-918480798.jpg\" alt=\"Map of Europe in blue with light shining through\" width=\"1024\" height=\"761\" srcset=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/GettyImages-918480798.jpg 1400w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/GettyImages-918480798.jpg?resize=150,112 https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/GettyImages-918480798.jpg?resize=680,506 680w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/GettyImages-918480798.jpg?resize=50,37 50w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px\" \/><p id=\"caption-attachment-2123284\" class=\"wp-caption-text\"><strong>Image Credits:<\/strong> <a href=\"https:\/\/www.gettyimages.com\/search\/photographer?family=creative&amp;photographer=Sean+Gladwell\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Sean Gladwell <span class=\"screen-reader-text\">(opens in a new window)<\/span><\/a> \/ Getty Images<\/p><\/div><\/p>\n<p>Many investors will encourage CEOs to remain U.S.-centric this year and perhaps expand their product offering or move into new market segments. But 95% of the world\u2019s population lives outside the U.S., making an expansion into Europe your best growth lever.<\/p>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"tXMdt4ROZP\"><p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/09\/proactive-ceos-should-prioritize-european-expansion\/\">Proactive CEOs should prioritize European expansion<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p><iframe class=\"wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" title=\"&#8220;Proactive CEOs should prioritize European expansion&#8221; &#8212; TechCrunch\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/09\/proactive-ceos-should-prioritize-european-expansion\/embed\/#?secret=tXMdt4ROZP\" data-secret=\"tXMdt4ROZP\" width=\"800\" height=\"450\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n<p>&nbsp;<\/p>\n<h2>Coupang follows Roblox to a strong first day of trading<\/h2>\n<p><div id=\"attachment_2122752\" style=\"width: 1034px\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><img aria-describedby=\"caption-attachment-2122752\" loading=\"lazy\" class=\"size-full wp-image-2122752\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/GettyImages-1231269853.jpg\" alt=\"A Coupang Corp. delivery truck drives past a company's fulfillment center in Bucheon, South Korea, on Friday, Feb. 19, 2021. South Korean e-commerce giant Coupang filed for an initial public offering in the U.S. and that could raise billions of dollars to battle rivals and kick off a record year for IPOs in the Asian country. Photographer: SeongJoon Cho\/Bloomberg via Getty Images\" width=\"1024\" height=\"683\" srcset=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/GettyImages-1231269853.jpg 1024w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/GettyImages-1231269853.jpg?resize=150,100 150w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/GettyImages-1231269853.jpg?resize=300,200 300w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/GettyImages-1231269853.jpg?resize=768,512 768w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/GettyImages-1231269853.jpg?resize=680,454 680w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/GettyImages-1231269853.jpg?resize=50,33 50w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px\" \/><p id=\"caption-attachment-2122752\" class=\"wp-caption-text\"><strong>Image Credits:\u00a0<\/strong><a href=\"https:\/\/www.gettyimages.hk\/search\/photographer?assettype=image&amp;family=editorial&amp;photographer=Bloomberg&amp;sort=best#license\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Bloomberg\u00a0<span class=\"screen-reader-text\">(opens in a new window)<\/span><\/a>\/\u00a0Getty Images<\/p><\/div><\/p>\n<p>After Roblox debuted on Wednesday, Coupang followed, with shares shooting above the South Korean e-commerce giant\u2019s IPO price range. Quick math shows Coupang is worth around $92 billion at the moment, a huge number that nearly zero companies will ever reach.<\/p>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"k162cAjiHF\"><p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/11\/coupang-follows-roblox-to-a-strong-first-day-of-trading\/\">Coupang follows Roblox to a strong first day of trading<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p><iframe class=\"wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n<p>&nbsp;<\/p>\n<h2>How and when to hire your first product manager<\/h2>\n<p><div id=\"attachment_2121420\" srcset=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/01\/GettyImages-1039548992.jpg 2119w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/01\/GettyImages-1039548992.jpg?resize=150,100 overlapping skill sets, it can be tricky to find the right candidate.<\/p>\n<p>While it\u2019s different for every company, hiring a PM ensures companies aren\u2019t \u201cchasing the shiny object\u201d but rather building the things that create enduring value for customers.<\/p>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"k2EzpmbapI\"><p><a marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n<p>&nbsp;<\/p>\n<h2>Deep Science: AI adventures in arts and letters<\/h2>\n<p><div id=\"attachment_1773691\" style=\"width: filing offers a glimpse into the finances of how an edtech company, accelerated by the pandemic, performed over the past year.<\/p>\n<p>It paints a picture of growth, albeit one that came at steep expense.<\/p>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"clxXh1Z0AG\"><p><a profits? monitors supply chains from raw material inputs to finished outputs with an eye toward sustainable sourcing, shows the firm\u2019s dedication to backing companies across the mobility space broadly.<\/p>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"Ox2j6fk5KM\"><p><a win the battle for podcast discovery<\/h2>\n<p><div id=\"attachment_2122519\" style=\"width: 1034px\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><img aria-describedby=\"caption-attachment-2122519\" roughly 128 million Americans to use a voice assistant at least once a month.<\/p>\n<p>This has created a golden opportunity for audio as consumers turn to podcasts, voice assistants and smart speakers.<\/p>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"gpn4zGHMIE\"><p><a height=\"450\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n<p>&nbsp;<\/p>\n<h2>Why I&#8217;m hitting pause on ARR-focused coverage<\/h2>\n<p><div id=\"attachment_1996010\" style=\"width: 1034px\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><img aria-describedby=\"caption-attachment-1996010\" loading=\"lazy\" class=\"size-full wp-image-1996010\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/05\/NSussman_Techcrunch_Exchange_v3-ORNG.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1024\" height=\"768\" srcset=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/05\/NSussman_Techcrunch_Exchange_v3-ORNG.jpg 2880w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/05\/NSussman_Techcrunch_Exchange_v3-ORNG.jpg?resize=300,225 300w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/05\/NSussman_Techcrunch_Exchange_v3-ORNG.jpg?resize=768,576 768w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/05\/NSussman_Techcrunch_Exchange_v3-ORNG.jpg?resize=680,510 680w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/05\/NSussman_Techcrunch_Exchange_v3-ORNG.jpg?resize=1536,1152 1536w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/05\/NSussman_Techcrunch_Exchange_v3-ORNG.jpg?resize=2048,1536 2048w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/05\/NSussman_Techcrunch_Exchange_v3-ORNG.jpg?resize=50,38 50w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px\" \/><p id=\"caption-attachment-1996010\" class=\"wp-caption-text\"><strong>Image Credits:<\/strong> <a href=\"https:\/\/www.nigelsussman.com\/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Nigel Sussman <span class=\"screen-reader-text\">(opens in a new window)<\/span><\/a><\/p><\/div><\/p>\n<p>One of the first recurring features Alex Wilhelm established at Extra Crunch was the &#8220;$100M ARR Club,&#8221; ongoing coverage of startups that have reached scale.<\/p>\n<p>&#8220;Forget a $1 billion valuation \u2014 $100 million in annual recurring revenue is the cool kids&#8217; club,&#8221; he wrote in December 2019. Since then, he expanded it to cover companies that attained $50M ARR.<\/p>\n<p>The concept is a useful lens for studying the market. I can say this with confidence because it&#8217;s been widely copied by other tech news outlets. But this morning, Alex surprised me \u2014 he&#8217;s shelving the ARR Club, at least for now.<\/p>\n<p>&#8220;In the end it became a pre-IPO list that was fun but not entirely educational, by my reckoning,&#8221; he told me. &#8220;The $50M ARR club evolution was supposed to help shake loose more interesting operational details, but just didn&#8217;t.&#8221;<\/p>\n<p>Before putting the format on hiatus, Alex&#8217;s last ARR Club roundup looks at in-office display and kiosk startup AppSpace, data backup unicorn Druva, and Synack, which makes security software.<\/p>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"2dzrMtWCTi\"><p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/12\/why-im-hitting-pause-on-arr-focused-coverage\/\">Why I&#8217;m hitting pause on ARR-focused coverage<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p><iframe class=\"wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" title=\"&#8220;Why I&#8217;m hitting pause on ARR-focused coverage&#8221; &#8212; TechCrunch\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/12\/why-im-hitting-pause-on-arr-focused-coverage\/embed\/#?secret=2dzrMtWCTi\" data-secret=\"2dzrMtWCTi\" width=\"800\" height=\"450\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n<hr \/>\n<h2>TC Early Stage: The premier how-to event for startup entrepreneurs and investors<\/h2>\n<p>From April 1-2, some of the most successful founders and VCs will explain how they build their businesses, raise money and manage their portfolios.<\/p>\n<p>At TC Early Stage, we&#8217;ll cover topics like recruiting, sales, legal, PR, marketing and brand building. Each session includes ample time for audience questions and discussion.<\/p>\n<p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/events\/tc-early-stage-2021-part-1\/?promo=ecnewsletter&amp;display=true\">Use discount code ECNEWSLETTER<\/a> to take 20% off the cost of your TC Early Stage ticket!<\/p>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>Our growing library of how-to stories are aimed squarely at early-stage founders and workers trying to solve long-term Ventures","slug":"inmotion-ventures","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/576597588"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=576597588"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=576597588"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=576597588"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=576597588"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}},{"id":2097093,"link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/tag\/roblox\/","name":"Roblox","slug":"roblox","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/2097093"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=2097093"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=2097093"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=2097093"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=2097093"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}}],[],[],[],[]]}},{"id":2124769,"date":"2021-03-12T15:10:25","date_gmt":"2021-03-12T23:10:25","guid":{"rendered":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/?p=2124769"},"modified":"2021-03-12T14:51:03","modified_gmt":"2021-03-12T22:51:03","slug":"daily-crunch-marco-rubio-sides-with-amazon-workers","status":"publish","type":"post","link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/12\/daily-crunch-marco-rubio-sides-with-amazon-workers\/","title":{"rendered":"Daily Crunch: Marco Rubio sides with Amazon workers"},"content":{"rendered":"<p id=\"speakable-summary\">A prominent Republican senator weighs in on Amazon&#8217;s labor disputes, Microsoft reports a security vulnerability in Exchange and we examine ByteDance&#8217;s gaming strategy. This is your Daily Crunch for March 12, 2021.<\/p>\n<p><strong>The big story: Marco Rubio sides with Amazon workers<\/strong><\/p>\n<p>Senator Marco Rubio published <a href=\"https:\/\/www.usatoday.com\/story\/opinion\/2021\/03\/12\/amazon-union-not-helping-working-class-economy-column\/6947823002\/\">an op-ed<\/a> in USA Today <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/12\/marco-rubio-says-he-stands-with-amazon-warehouse-workers\/\">declaring his support for workers in Amazon&#8217;s warehouse<\/a> in Bessemer, Alabama, as they seek to unionize.<\/p><div class=\"piano-inline-promo\"><\/div>\n<p>It&#8217;s surprising for a Republican senator to throw his weight behind a nascent labor union, but it seems that Rubio&#8217;s position has as much to do with his feelings about Amazon as his labor politics. In fact, his op-ed warned of the &#8220;dangers posed by the unchecked influence of labor unions,&#8221; while also arguing that Amazon is guilty of &#8220;uniquely malicious corporate behavior.\u201d<\/p>\n<p><strong>The tech giants<\/strong><\/p>\n<p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/12\/hackers-exchange-servers-ransomware\/\">Hackers are exploiting vulnerable Exchange servers to drop ransomware, Microsoft says<\/a> \u2014 This puts tens of thousands of email servers at risk of destructive attacks.<\/p>\n<p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/12\/bytedance-gaming\/\">How ByteDance plans to crack the gaming industry<\/a> \u2014\u00a0The company&#8217;s strategy consists of a genre-spanning portfolio, a hiring spree, a proven monetization scheme, and a focus on both the domestic and overseas markets.<\/p>\n<p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/12\/elon-musk-tesla-board-sued-in-lawsuit-alleging-erratic-tweets-violate-fiduciary-duty\/\">Elon Musk, Tesla board sued in lawsuit alleging \u2018erratic\u2019 tweets violate fiduciary duty<\/a>\u00a0\u2014\u00a0A Tesla investor is suing the company board and Musk for continuing to send \u201cerratic tweets\u201d that violate a settlement with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission that requires oversight of his social media activities.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Startups, funding and venture capital<\/strong><\/p>\n<p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/12\/assembled-an-operating-system-for-support-teams-raises-16-6m\/\">Assembled, an operating system for support teams, raises $16.6M<\/a> \u2014\u00a0The round was led by Emergence Capital, a VC that specializes in enterprise startups.<\/p>\n<p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/12\/eying-sustainability-gains-for-its-supply-chain-bmw-backs-boston-metals-co2-free-iron-production-tech\/\">Eying sustainability gains for its supply chain, BMW backs Boston Metal\u2019s CO2-free iron production tech<\/a> \u2014\u00a0The Boston startup had targeted a $50 million raise earlier in the year, and BMW\u2019s addition closes out that round.<\/p>\n<p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/11\/legl-gets-7m-to-help-law-firms-upgrade-to-digital-workflows\/\">Legl gets $7M to help law firms upgrade to digital workflows<\/a> \u2014\u00a0The Legl platform offers tools to streamline core business processes such as customer onboarding, due diligence and payments.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Advice and analysis from Extra Crunch<\/strong><\/p>\n<p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/12\/how-nontechnical-talent-can-break-into-deep-tech\/\">How nontechnical talent can break into deep tech<\/a> \u2014 Tactical advice for finding, reaching out to, cultivating relationships with, and working at deep tech companies.<\/p>\n<p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/12\/us-listed-spacs-have-a-new-target-latin-american-tech-companies\/\">US-listed SPACs have a new target: Latin American tech companies<\/a> \u2014\u00a0There has been an unprecedented IPO boom of tech companies in the Brazilian stock exchange.<\/p>\n<p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/12\/why-im-hitting-pause-on-arr-focused-coverage\/\">Why I\u2019m hitting pause on ARR-focused coverage<\/a> \u2014\u00a0Alex Wilhelm says that ultimately, he was getting similar notes from each company.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Everything else<\/strong><\/p>\n<p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/12\/big-tech-companies-cannot-be-trusted-to-self-regulate-we-need-congress-to-act\/\">Big Tech companies cannot be trusted to self-regulate: We need Congress to act<\/a> \u2014\u00a0Thoughts from Color of Change&#8217;s Arisha Hatch.<\/p>\n<p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/12\/introducing-the-updated-virtual-startup-alley-experience-at-tc-disrupt-2021\/\">Here are the new features and upgraded virtual Startup Alley experience at TC Disrupt 2021<\/a> \u2014\u00a0This year, we\u2019re shaking things up a bit to help exhibiting founders make the most of a virtual environment.<\/p>\n<p><em>The Daily Crunch is TechCrunch&#8217;s roundup of our biggest and most important stories. If you&#8217;d like to get this delivered to your inbox every day at around 3pm Pacific, you can <a href=\"http:\/\/link.techcrunch.com\/join\/134\/signup-all-newsletters\">subscribe here<\/a>.<\/em><\/p>\n<p><a href=\"http:\/\/link.techcrunch.com\/join\/134\/signup-all-newsletters\"><img loading=\"lazy\" class=\"aligncenter wp-image-1764565 size-large\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2019\/01\/Dk-_nQ.png?w=680\" alt=\"\" width=\"680\" height=\"191\" srcset=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2019\/01\/Dk-_nQ.png 680w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2019\/01\/Dk-_nQ.png?resize=150,42 150w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2019\/01\/Dk-_nQ.png?resize=300,84 300w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2019\/01\/Dk-_nQ.png?resize=50,14 50w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 680px) 100vw, 680px\" \/><\/a><\/p>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>A prominent Republican senator weighs in on Amazon&#8217;s labor disputes, Microsoft reports a security vulnerability in Exchange and we examine ByteDance&#8217;s gaming strategy. Crunch Live: Mayfield and Poshmark"},"content":{"rendered":"<p id=\"speakable-summary\"><em>Wednesday, March 24 at 11:30am PT \/ 2:30pm ET<\/em><\/p>\n<p id=\"speakable-summary\">Poshmark raised upwards of $150 million before filing to go public in 2019. Today, it has a market cap north of $5 billion. Mayfield\u2019s Navin Chaddha led the company\u2019s Series A all the way back in 2011, back when Poshmark was called Gosh Posh. Hear Chaddha and Poshmark founder Manish Chandra discuss a decade of growth, and walk us through how they came together more than ten years ago. Then the duo will take a look at pitch decks submitted by audience members.<\/p>\n<p><a class=\"button button--gold-gradient button--secondary\" href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/02\/18\/check-out-the-incredible-speakers-joining-us-on-extra-crunch-live-in-march\/\">Extra Crunch members click for dial in details<\/a><\/p>\n<p><a class=\"button button--green-gradient button--primary\" href=\"https:\/\/hopin.com\/events\/extra-crunch-live-mayfield-and-poshmark\">Buy Tickets<\/a><\/p>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>Wednesday, March 24 at 11:30am PT \/ 2:30pm ET Poshmark raised upwards of $150 million before filing to go public in 2019. Today, it has a market cap north of $5 billion. Mayfield\u2019s Navin Chaddha led the company\u2019s Series A all the way back in 2011, back when Poshmark was called Gosh Posh. A few years ago, VCs were focused on growth over profitability. Now, making money is just as important, if not more, than sheer growth. And we\u2019re in the midst of a global pandemic, which has brought the economy to a crawl and forced entrepreneurs to rethink both their short and long-term priorities.\n\nStartups want to hear from the voices they trust for guidance on how to navigate this difficult situation. That\u2019s why we\u2019re excited to introduce Extra Crunch Live, a virtual speaker series complete with live Q&A exclusive for Extra Crunch members.","blocks":[{"text":"<p><em>Wednesday, March 24 at 11:30am PT \/ 2:30pm ET<\/em><\/p><p>Poshmark raised upwards of $150 million before filing to go public in 2019. Crunch Live: Flourish Ventures and Steady"},"content":{"rendered":"<p id=\"speakable-summary\"><em>Wednesday, March 17 at 11:30am PT \/ 2:30pm ET<\/em><\/p>\n<p id=\"speakable-summary\">Emmalyn Shaw co-manages a $500 million fintech fund in Flourish Ventures, with portfolio companies that include Brigit, Chime, Clerkie, Cushion, EarnUp, Kin, Propel, and SeedFi. She also led the Series A deal for Steady, founded by Adam Roseman, back in 2018. Hear from Emmalyn and Adam about how they came together, what it takes to get funding and be successful in the fintech space, and get their live feedback on audience-submitted pitch decks.<\/p>\n<p><a class=\"button button--gold-gradient button--secondary\" href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/02\/18\/check-out-the-incredible-speakers-joining-us-on-extra-crunch-live-in-march\/\">Extra Crunch members click for dial in details<\/a><\/p>\n<p><a class=\"button button--green-gradient button--primary\" href=\"https:\/\/hopin.com\/events\/extra-crunch-live-flourish-ventures-and-steady\">Buy Tickets<\/a><\/p>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>Wednesday, March 17 at 11:30am PT \/ 2:30pm ET Emmalyn Shaw co-manages a $500 million fintech fund in Flourish Ventures, with portfolio companies that include Brigit, Chime, Clerkie, Cushion, EarnUp, Kin, Propel, and SeedFi. She also led the Series A deal for Steady, founded by Adam Roseman, back in 2018. Hear from Emmalyn and Adam [&hellip;]<\/p>\n","protected":false},"featured_media":2116184,"parent":0,"menu_order":0,"template":"","tc_event":[576857613],"rapidData":{"pt":"","pct":""},"agenda":{"sessionTypes":[],"sessionData":[{"date":"17 March","sessions":[{"guid":"6943054960341982d23de","start":"11:30 am","end":"1:30 pm","description":"","title":"Extra Crunch Live: Flourish Ventures and Steady","videoUrl":"","sessionTypeId":false,"speakers":[],"sponsors":[],"tags":[]}]}]},"bannerImageURL":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/04\/gian-d-359346-unsplash.jpg","bannerTextStyle":"light","description":"The startup world\u00a0is going through yet another evolution. A few years ago, VCs were focused on growth over profitability. Now, making money is just as important, if not more, than sheer growth. And we\u2019re in the midst of a global pandemic, which has brought the economy to a crawl and forced entrepreneurs to rethink both their short and long-term priorities.\n\nStartups want to hear from the voices they trust for guidance on how to navigate this difficult situation. That\u2019s why we\u2019re excited to introduce Extra Crunch Live, a virtual speaker series complete with live Q&A exclusive for Extra Crunch members.","blocks":[{"text":"<p><em>Wednesday, March 17 at 11:30am PT \/ 2:30pm ET<\/em><\/p><p>Emmalyn Shaw co-manages a $500 million fintech fund in Flourish Ventures, with portfolio companies that include Brigit, Chime, Clerkie, Cushion, EarnUp, Kin, Propel, and SeedFi. She also led the Series A deal for Steady, founded by Adam Roseman, back in 2018. Hear from Emmalyn and Adam about how they came together, what it takes to get funding and be successful in the fintech space, and get their live feedback on audience-submitted pitch decks.<\/p><p><a class=\"button button--gold-gradient button--secondary\" href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/02\/18\/check-out-the-incredible-speakers-joining-us-on-extra-crunch-live-in-march\/\">Extra Crunch members click for dial in details<\/a><\/p><p><a class=\"button button--green-gradient button--primary\" href=\"https:\/\/hopin.com\/events\/extra-crunch-live-flourish-ventures-and-steady\">Buy Tickets<\/a><\/p>","title":"Extra Crunch Live: Flourish Ventures and Steady","type":"text","panels_info":{"class":"TC\\Page_Builder\\TinyMCE\\Widget","grid":0,"cell":0,"id":0,"style":{"background_image_attachment":false,"background_display":"tile"}},"uid":"b738ae34-57c5-486e-8b69-babca00ec8d8","backgroundImageURL":null},{"uid":"102a2e7c-87ee-4f80-a06f-47ff671b734e","panels_info":{"class":"TC\\Page_Builder\\Events\\Agenda_Block","raw":false,"grid":0,"cell":0,"id":1},"type":"event-agenda"}],"blockMetadata":{"agenda":{"title":""},"speakers":{"title":""},"sponsors":{"title":""},"newsletter":{"title":"","content":""},"video":{"title":""}},"blockNavigation":null,"videoCarouselPlaylistID":"","livestreams":false,"promotionReelHash":"","eventStatus":"pre","exhibitorData":[],"marketingOffers":{"countdown":{"display":false},"ctaBlock":{"display":false}},"marketoID":"","navigation":{"blocks":[{"text":"<p><em>Wednesday, March 17 at 11:30am PT \/ 2:30pm ET<\/em><\/p><p>Emmalyn Shaw co-manages a $500 million fintech fund in Flourish Ventures, with portfolio companies that include Brigit, Chime, Clerkie, Cushion, EarnUp, Kin, Propel, and SeedFi. She also led the Series A deal for Steady, founded by Adam Roseman, back in 2018. Hear from Emmalyn and Adam about how they came together, what it takes to get funding and be successful in the fintech space, and get their live feedback on audience-submitted pitch decks.<\/p><p><a The startups selected for Startup Alley+ will receive access to founder-focused masterclasses, introductions to investors and additional opportunities to pitch to the TechCrunch audience. You will be asked to provide your billing information that will be shown on the invoice and once you finalize registration, you'll be emailed an invoice with instructions on how to pay via wire.<\/p>\n<p>All wire payments will need to be <strong>RECEIVED<\/strong>\u00a0by our Accounts Receivable's team no later than September 1, 2020 or any pass reservations will be cancelled. Please note that it sometimes takes up to 2-3 weeks for the Accounts Receivable team to verify payment so submit your payments as soon as possible to ensure you meet this deadline before your pass is cancelled. Once payment has been verified, you will receive an email confirming that your payment has been applied to your order. Dmitri is one of the original members of the Google self-driving car project, which became Waymo in 2016. In his role at Waymo, Dmitri leads the development of all self-driving hardware and software.<\/p>\n\n<p>Prior to Waymo, Dmitri worked on self-driving cars at Toyota and at Stanford as part of Stanford's DARPA Urban Challenge team. In 2008, he was named one of \"AI's ten to watch -- the Future of AI\" by the IEEE Intelligent Systems Magazine. Dmitri received his B.S. and M.S. in Physics and Math from the Moscow Institute of Physics and Technology and a Ph.D. in Computer Science from the University of Michigan.<\/p>","cbAvatar":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/01\/wpisdcbsmwrkb332o4vv.jpg","company":"Waymo","featured":0,"name":"Dmitri Dolgov","uuid":"b60a30b399814b1ea0410d6f6d4eb5b1","cb_tag":576652128,"position":"CTO & VP of Engineering","links":{"crunchbase":"https:\/\/www.crunchbase.com\/person\/dmitry-dolgov","linkedin":"https:\/\/www.linkedin.com\/in\/dmitri-dolgov-127a331\/"}},{"bio":"<p>Nancy Sun is the Co-Founder and Chief Engineer of Ike, an automated trucking startup building cutting-edge automation technology to help improve the trucking industry in the safest way possible. \nPrior to founding Ike, Nancy was the Engineering Lead for the self-driving truck program at Uber\u2019s Advanced Technologies Group, which she joined via the Otto acquisition in 2016. Nancy\u2019s deep expertise in systems engineering and transportation extends beyond Uber to Apple, where she was an Engineering Manager for their Special Projects Group, and electric motorcycle startup Mission Motors, where she was the VP of Advanced Development.\nNancy has bachelors and masters degrees in Engineering from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology and it was during her years at MIT that she first developed a love of robotics.<\/p>","cbAvatar":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/01\/pnr5f549ndtq20qu7rmw.jpg","company":"Ike","featured":0,"name":"Nancy Sun","uuid":"b86bd1cbf32d454d93bfd118f5c46228","cb_tag":576739373,"position":"Co-Founder & Chief Engineer","links":{"crunchbase":"https:\/\/www.crunchbase.com\/person\/nancy-sun-6228","linkedin":"https:\/\/www.linkedin.com\/in\/nancy-sun-50a27414\/"}},{"bio":"<p>Since the completion of design studies at the Fachhochschule f\u00fcr Gestaltung in Pforzheim and the Royal College of Art in London, Thomas has had more than 20 years of experience in the automotive industry. He has worked in top design positions at Audi, Volkswagen and Skoda. In 2006, he was appointed as the Director for Design at the Volkswagen Design Centre in Potsdam, designing for all brands of the Volkswagen Group. Thomas joined Volvo Car Corporation on July 1, 2012 as Senior Vice President of Design and led the turnaround of the brand and product portfolio. Thomas Ingenlath was appointed Chief Executive Officer of Polestar on June 17, 2017; he also holds the dual-role of Chief Design Officer for the Volvo Car Group.<\/p>","cbAvatar":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/01\/azjryntdhtt581wdtz82.jpg","company":"Polestar","featured":0,"name":"Thomas Ingenlath","uuid":"880d40091c5e6d9e5e8fd70e12a29ac1","cb_tag":576811324,"position":"CEO","links":{"crunchbase":"https:\/\/www.crunchbase.com\/person\/ingenlath-thomas","linkedin":"https:\/\/se.linkedin.com\/pub\/ingenlath-thomas\/17\/5b6\/262\/en"}},{"bio":"<p>Dr. Jesse Levinson is the co-founder and CTO of Zoox, a venture-backed startup creating ground-up, fully autonomous electric vehicles for point-to-point mobility in cities. Jesse is responsible for overseeing the company\u2019s software, artificial intelligence, computing, and sensing platforms.<\/p>\n\n<p>Prior to Zoox, Jesse graduated summa cum laude from Princeton and then completed a computer science Ph.D. and postdoc under Sebastian Thrun at Stanford. There, he developed algorithms for Stanford\u2019s $1M-winning entry in the 2007 DARPA Urban Challenge, and went on to lead the self-driving car team\u2019s research efforts. Jesse also co-created a popular mobile photography app, Pro HDR, that has been purchased by more than a million people.<\/p>","cbAvatar":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/01\/pszd6dyxvsmv86yqms2r.jpg","company":"Zoox","featured":0,"name":"Jesse Levinson","uuid":"abf846955f75d4266c0a8be0df37cce1","cb_tag":576670492,"position":"Co-founder & CTO","links":{"crunchbase":"https:\/\/www.crunchbase.com\/person\/jesse-levinson-ph-d"}},{"bio":"<p>Paul C. Ajegba has 30 years of experience with the Michigan Department of Transportation, and was appointed by Governor Gretchen Whitmer as Director on Jan. 1, 2019. He previously served MDOT for three months as Metro Region Engineer, and before that as University Region Engineer. During his seven years in the University Region, Ajegba oversaw his team's involvement in the planning, design and construction of several major projects, including the US-23 Flex Route - a project nominated for the America's Transportation Award, landing among the top 12 national finalists. Other notable projects include the I-94 rehabilitation project in Ann Arbor\/Jackson, the I-96\/US-23 interchange, and the I-75 freeway project.<\/p>\n\n<p>Ajegba holds a Bachelor of Science in civil engineering from Prairie View A&amp;M University and a Master\u2019s Degree in construction engineering from the University of Michigan. He is a licensed professional engineer in the State of Michigan.<\/p>\n\n<p>Paul is a member of COMTO (Conference of Minority Transportation Officials), and serves on the following boards: AASHTO, ITS America, M-City, University of Michigan College of Engineering, the Engineering Society of Detroit, and the Mackinac Bridge Authority.<\/p>","cbAvatar":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/01\/t9miuk88zo6rrpuvnzdf.jpg","company":"Michigan Department of Transportation","featured":0,"name":"Paul Ajegba","uuid":"3e96485618ae4d2a91ff3fb01ec495d3","cb_tag":576812988,"position":"Director","links":{"crunchbase":"https:\/\/www.crunchbase.com\/person\/paul-ajegba"}},{"bio":"<p>Regina is the CEO and Co-founder of Populus, a data platform for cities to manage the future of mobility. Trusted by leading cities and the world\u2019s largest mobility operators, the Populus platform securely ingests real-time data from shared electric scooters, bikes, and cars - helping operators and cities partner to deliver safe, equitable, and efficient streets through better data and analytics.<\/p>\n\n<p>Regina has over a decade of experience in transportation, having served as a research scientist and lecturer at Stanford, UC Berkeley, and UC Davis. Prior to forming Populus, Regina was the Director of Business Development and Strategy at RideScout, an early mobility-as-a-service aggregator that was acquired by moovel, Daimler and BMW\u2019s mobility services unit. Regina has been named a 40 Under 40 by Mass Transit magazine and the San Francisco Business Times. She has a Ph.D. in transportation and energy systems from MIT, and a bachelor\u2019s in computer science from Cornell.<\/p>","cbAvatar":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/01\/bz94c53cz9mzavbqk7ux.jpg","company":"Populus","featured":0,"name":"Regina Clewlow","uuid":"e09d826a9af8c930636cc3907c0727b5","cb_tag":576649050,"position":"Co-founder & CEO","links":{"crunchbase":"https:\/\/www.crunchbase.com\/person\/regina-clewlow","twitter":"https:\/\/twitter.com\/ReginaClewlow","linkedin":"https:\/\/www.linkedin.com\/in\/clewlow"}},{"bio":"<p>Bryan is passionate about incorporating promising robotics technology into products and systems that will improve safety and productivity while enhancing people\u2019s lives. While at Carnegie Mellon University\u2019s National Robotics Engineering Center (NREC), Bryan managed a portfolio of the center\u2019s largest commercial programs, including autonomous mining trucks for Caterpillar. In 2007, Bryan led software engineering for Tartan Racing, Carnegie Mellon\u2019s winning entry in the DARPA Urban Challenge.<\/p>\n\n<p>Bryan departed NREC and joined the Google self-driving car team in 2011 to continue the push toward making self-driving cars a reality. While at Google, Bryan was responsible for the development and manufacture of their hardware portfolio, which included self-driving sensors, computers and several vehicle development programs.
